tech_stack: Quality Assurance  Vulnerability Management  Cyber Security  Scripting  User Management  Encryption  Orchestration  Network Security  Vpn  Incident Management  Business Requirements  continuous process improvement  Access Control  anomaly detection  Prevention  Cissp
job_description:
Job Description
The candidate will report to Head (SecOps) and is responsible to design, develop and implement secure system architecture. The design secure system architecture will embed with security principles to protect company's infrastructure and information asset from cyber threats that are constantly evolving. This role will be working with a team of cyber security enthusiasts to safeguard our systems against cyber-attacks and threats. The candidate needs to possess strong technical competency and an effective communication skill to engage various company's stakeholders. He/She will perform routine activities related to the periodic review and audit activities of infrastructure security systems and maintains documentation of security standards and procedures.
Responsibilities:
1. Develop architecture requirements and maintain oversight
Design security controls and systems in alignment with security guidelines
Assist in the testing and evaluation of new security technologies and controls
Recommend security products, services and procedures to enhance system architecture designs
Document the design, operation, use, and expected outputs of new systems
Conduct research on modern security software architectures and network architecture design best practices
Drive continuous process improvement for the security services
2. Implement security systems
Implement new enterprise security architecture, technologies and enhancements
Identify techniques to scale up and automate security infrastructure and processes
Resolve issues that arise in implementation of new security systems
Monitor security systems for strengths and weaknesses and propose improvements to address weaknesses
3. Manage security systems
Responsible for the maintenance of security systems, platforms and associated software
Develop and implement custom disaster recovery drills and simulation tests on existing systems
Monitors, tracks and manages service faults till resolution and change requests.
Manages lifecycle of security solutions, ensuring that the solution is up-to-date and relevant to changing business needs and security landscape
Provide oversight and drive quality assurance over third party service providers
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field, or a similar field. Ideally, you have completed or are about to complete a Security certification (e.g. Security+, GCIA, GCIH, CISSP). And competent in scripting languages (e.g. Perl, Python, etc.).
Experiences in the following areas:
1. Business Needs Analysis
Elicit and analyse business requirements from key stakeholders and assess relevant solutions and their potential impact
2. Cyber and Data Breach Incident Management
Provide root causes analysis and assessment on the implications of incidents.
3. Cyber Risk Management
Develop cyber risk assessment techniques and roll-out endorsed measures to address identified cyber security risks, threats and vulnerabilities
4. Emerging Technology Synthesis
Conduct research and identify opportunities for new and emerging technology to support the business needs
5. Infrastructure Design
Translate a broader infrastructure blueprint into technical specifications and develop prototypes for simple infrastructure components
6. Network Security
Manage network security solution
7. Security Administration
Administer, configure and troubleshoot security solution platforms, and analyse impact of patches and updates on system and networks. Minimum 4 years of administration experience (see Technologies Competencies)
8. Security Architecture
Design secure systems and define security specifications of components, integrating appropriate security controls.
9. Security Programme Management
Detail the security requirements for system architecture components and implement security programmes. Minimum 2 years of implementation experience. (see Technologies Competencies)
10. Strategy Implementation
Evaluate strategies for critical business functions to ensure plans are realistic and reflect health of business.
11. Strategy Planning
Develop resource allocation plans and implement strategies and policies
12. Technologies Competencies
Networking, Network Taps and Data Diode, Host Security (Windows, Unix, Linux), Firewall (Packet Filtering, Application, Database, Web Application), VPN (IPSec & SSL), Distributed Denial of Service Protection, Content Disarm & Reconstruction, Public Key Infrastructure, Encryption (At-rest and in-transit), Data Loss Protection, Data Integrity, User Anomaly Detection, Intrusion Prevention System, Network Access Control, Forward Proxy, Reverse Proxy, Email Security Gateway (anti-spam, anti-virus, anti-malware, sandbox, EBC), Endpoint (Email, Anti-virus, Antimalware), Threat Detection & Response (Endpoint& Network), Vulnerability Management, Web Isolation, Log Management, Security Incident & Event Management, Security Orchestration, Cloud Security, Identity & Access Management, 2-Factor Authentication, Single Sign On, Privileged User Management, Mobile Device Management

About Standard Chartered
We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.
To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.
We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.
The Role Responsibilities

Strategy
To drive strategy, direction and implementation of data engineering and architecture.
To mentor data engineers to clarify Epics/Stories, provide estimations and derive design decisions.
To participate and facilitates interviews for future hiring of data engineers.

To lead a team of data engineers to:

Support the data pipeline flow for machine learning and advanced analytics solutions with the aim of improving yields from the business and enable improved customer experience.

Make the data products production-ready and deployable for use of internal customers.

Conducting functional and non-functional testing on large scale data platforms like unit testing, integrations testing, system testing, performance testing and volume testing.

Handling incident and exception management and building robust data pipelines.

Provide recommendations for data improvement, quality, and efficiency of data.

Ensure and support the data architecture utilized by business, data scientists and analysts.

Development of data processes for data modelling, mining, and data production.

Design and implement backup and recovery strategy


Business

Experience working in financial services particularly in FCSO area will be an added advantage.



Regulatory & Business Conduct

Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group&rsquos Values and Code of Conduct.

Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.

Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.


Key Stakeholders

FCSO Data Team


Other Responsibilities

To perform other duties as assigned.



Our Ideal Candidate


10+ yeas of Data Warehouse, Data Lake Architecture and Development.

Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

Good verbal and written communication skills

Strong analytical and problem solving and ability to prioritize and organize multiple task

Team management experience and ability to lead project solution end-to-end.

Ability to learn and adapt to new technologies and frameworks

Good programming & debugging skills with Code Quality measures

Ability to handle raw and unstructured data.

Good understanding of software development life cycle using Agile/Waterfall models & Process adherence

Understanding of Coding standards, Design patterns and guidelines. Understanding on source control, versioning, branching etc.

Database - strong RDBMS skills around writing efficient SQL&rsquos and complex procedures.

Knowledge/hands-on, Big Data Toolset such asHadoop, HDFS, HIVE, KAFKA, SPARK, Bash Scripting, & Any reporting tools like (Tableau, Dataiku, Alteryx, Paxata, MSTR, SAS & Dremio, SRE knowledge)

Familiar with Enterprise Data Warehouse and Reference Data Management is a plus

Familiar with Control M, Airflow

Familiar with ETL process, Hadoop

Familiar with Spark, Data API, MLP

Familiar in SQL scripting, VB scripting and Python

Familiar with Unix / Linux and batch scripting is a plus

Familiar with Performance Testing (e.g. volume testing) and Disaster Recovery Testing is a plus

Familiar with JIRA and Confluence



Role Specific Technical Competencies


Cloud-based Data Solution Architectures

Data Engineering Practices

ETL Tools and Platforms

Big Data Tech Stack

Data Modelling Techniques and Practices

Software Development Lifecycle

Cloud Migration Techniques and Patterns

Database Relational and Non-Relational Experiences

AI/ML Experiences



Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.

company: Seventh Sense Artificial Intelligence Private Limited
tech_stack: Tensorflow  Machine Learning  Software Engineering  Computer Vision  Pytorch  Vc  Docker  C++  Engineering Mathematics  Defense  Mathematics  Embedded Systems  Publishing  Ip  Publications  Benchmarking
job_description:
About us
Seventh Sense is an Edge-AI startup, democratizing AI. At Seventh Sense, we are solving the problem of running computationally intensive deep learning (AI) without the need for costly GPUs or Cloud. We make it possible to get GPU-class machine vision performance on commoditized hardware such as ubiquitous CPUs, mCPUs, embedded systems, and compute-constrained devices. This technology enables us to build our products which help in making our world a safer place.
Our Face Recognition engine accuracy is ranked amongst the top in NIST, LFW,IJB-C, and other benchmarks.
Co-founders have 2-decades of experience, each, and have a track record which includes successful exits one was acquired by McAfee/Intel, and second was registered on a Stock Exchange.
We are backed by well-known US based VC investors and recognized local investors, such as CapVista (the strategic investment arm of Singapore's Defense, Science and Technology Agency within Ministry of Defense).
Job Description
We are looking for Computer Vision Researchers and Engineers to work directly with one of the co-founders.
The person will work on concepts based on state-of-the-art research papers and apply his deep understanding of machine learning to develop and implement cutting-edge computer vision solutions and IP. Publishing of papers is encouraged and rewarded. If you are creative, collaborative and innovation-focused, and have the ability to explain and present analysis and machine learning concepts to a broad technical audience, then you will enjoy this role.
The role will also require collaborating with project and product teams to transfer knowledge application into solutions, and actively engage with academic community.
Background
Proven experience as an ML practitioner and researcher (minimum 2+ years on exception basis we will consider those with limited experience but having exceptional math and C++ skills)
Familiarity with Face Recognition and computer vision algorithms and libraries
Proficiency in Python/C++ required
Expertise in deep learning frameworks including PyTorch, TensorFlow
Strong software engineering skills including Git, CI/CD, Docker
Experience in REST API and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) is a plus
Ability to explain and present analysis and machine learning concepts to a broad technical audience
MS/PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, or similar field
Benefits
Health Care Plan
Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
Short Term & Long-Term Disability
Training & Development
Work From Home
Financial rewards for successful IP filings, and published papers
Stock Option Plan
Opportunities for international relocation and transfer

tech_stack: Web Services  .NET  Azure  Unit Testing  User Experience  Software Engineering  Application Development  Continuous Integration  Soa  Aws Lambda  S3  Databases  Software Development  Childcare  mastering  Audio Engineering
job_description:
About the role:
We are looking for a backend developer who will be focusing on the creation features of BandLab: MixEditor, Mastering, Sounds, Real-time collaboration, and Projects. You will be part of a high performing and highly motivated backend team. You're going to brainstorm with product managers, designers, backend, and frontend engineers to conceptualize and build new features for our large and growing user base. Be ready to design, implement and manage web services that impact millions of users. The role will help you grow in an environment passionate about knowledge-sharing and code review.
Responsibilities:
End-to-end ownership of systems you build: estimating, designing, developing, code review, performance optimization, documentation, testing, and monitoring
Collaborate with team members on design and implementation
Communicate with other teams during analysis and development phase
Design and build APIs
Write unit, functional and end-to-end tests
Write understandable, testable, and maintainable code
What you will be doing:
Develop new and maintain the existing Creation features
Work with our serverless infrastructure in Azure and AWS
Work with 2 stacks: .NET/C# and Node.js
Optimize costs of the exiting cloud infrastructure
Improve the user experience for our music creation tools
Collaborate with our audio engineering team
Requirements
At least 2 years of software engineering experience
Proficiency in at least one of .NET (C#/F#), Node.js, Go
Working experience with NoSQL databases
Working experience with cloud storages (e.g. AWS S3, Azure Storage) and CDNs
Understanding of RESTful web services, SOA and microservices architecture
Understanding of software engineering best practices including unit testing, continuous integration, continuous deployment, and source control
Commitment to high-quality and maintainable software
Nice-to-haves:
Hands-on experience with serverless technologies and techniques
Experience working in high-load client/server application development
Practical experience with IaC: CloudFormation, Serverless Framework
AWS Fargate and AWS Lambda
Working experience with CRDT
Understanding of CQRS
Benefits
Healthcare, dental insurance
Relocation sponsorship to sunny and cosmopolitan Singapore and/or remote working options
Attractive paid annual leave, sick leave, childcare leave, volunteer leave and maternity leave
BandLab Technologies staff discount
Cozy working place with modern workstations and regular team bonding activities

Assist in ensuring the health and uptime of services in the cross-cloud Kubernetes environment.

job_title: Attractive Job opening for Active Directory in Singapore
tech_stack: Paas  Css3  Multimedia  Azure  AWS  Systems Integration  Windows Server  Iaas  Actionscript  Active Directory
job_description:
Key Responsibilities

Job responsibilities include but not limited to:

Subject matter expert in Active Directory and associated components.
Develop solutions, procedures, implement test plans, develop migration plans, cross train technical analyst and oversee the implementation.
Delivers documentation for Active Directory solutions, works with second level support for implementation; serves as a third level escalation support to drive complex incidents or issue resolution.
Collaborates with solution architects, infrastructure specialists, application teams and project managers. Translate business needs into long-term architecture solutions; integrates applications authentication and authorization based on requirements to on-prem and cloud solutions. Develop strategies for new technologies and implement enterprise deployment in compliance with global standards. Evaluates new products andor services, provides recommendations and integrate Active Directory systems.
Demonstrates expertise in a variety of the fields concepts, practices, and procedures. Understand infrastructure services, networking topologies, protocols and practices. Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of complex tasks. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required. May lead, train, and direct the work of others.
Essential
Expert in Active Directory and Microsoft systems and associated components.
Large Enterprise Active Directory Design experience (greater than 30 Domain controllers) spanning multiple locations and business units.
Multi-forest expertise with an understanding of Kerberos and NLTM, LDAP and SAML protocols required.
In-depth understanding of Active Directory Replication, DNS, Site Links, Site Topology, Group Policy, Global Catalogs, Security, Domain Controllers and other core infrastructure components required.
Experience with the following technologies: Windows Server 20122016 required. Ability to use PowerShell to assist in the automation of tasks, required.
Performance baseline, backup and restore, disaster recovery, troubleshooting and complex problem solving on an enterprise network, large distributed Domain Controllers in multi-forest Active Directory environment.
Knowledgeable on deploying Domain Controllers, placing, on-boarding of new services, applicationsystems integration on a large distributed network.
Experienced on complex problem solving and troubleshooting of authentication services and systems integration.
Ability to consult and collaborate with application and infrastructure teams on Authentication / Authorization requirements and integration to directory services.
Soft skills: Good communicator (writing, verbal), self-learner, team player, flexible, reliable, proactive
Desirable
Cloud experience with IAAS and PAAS infrastructures and experience with AzureAD and AWS is desirable.
Specific Skill Requirement

Active Directory Design understanding,Windows Server 20122016, PowerShell Scripting & command experience, Domain Controllers promotion & demotion automation, understanding AD trust setup and requirements, troubleshooting AD connectivity and technical issues, Group Policies, AD Sites and Services, AD application integration, understanding of Kerberos and NLTM, LDAP and SAML protocols, ability to write solutions and develop technical instructions as well as coordinate and facilitate implementation.

company: Seventh Sense Artificial Intelligence Private Limited
tech_stack: Tensorflow  Machine Learning  Git  MongoDB  Azure  Software Engineering  Computer Vision  Pytorch  Vc  C++  Engineering Mathematics  Architectural  Mathematics  Embedded Systems  Rapid Prototyping  Electrical Engineering
job_description:
About Us
Seventh Sense is an Edge-AI startup, democratizing AI. At Seventh Sense, we are solving the problem of running computationally intensive deep learning (AI) without the need for costly GPUs or Cloud. We make it possible to get GPU-class machine vision performance on commoditized hardware such as ubiquitous CPUs, mCPUs, embedded systems, and compute-constrained devices. This technology enables us to build our products which help in making our world a safer place.
Our Face Recognition engine accuracy is ranked amongst the top in NIST, LFW, IJB-C, and other benchmarks.
Co-founders have 2-decades of experience, each, and have a track record which includes successful exits one was acquired by McAfee/Intel, and second was registered on a Stock Exchange.
We are backed by well-known US based VC investors and recognized local investors, such as CapVista (the strategic investment arm of Singapore's Defense, Science and Technology Agency within Ministry of Defense).
Job Description
We are looking for Computer Vision Researchers and Engineers to work directly with one of the co-founders.
The person will work on concepts based on state-of-the-art research papers and apply his deep understanding of machine learning to develop and implement cutting-edge computer vision solutions and IP. Publishing of papers is encouraged and rewarded. If you are creative, collaborative and innovation-focused, and have the ability to explain and present analysis and machine learning concepts to a broad technical audience, then you will enjoy this role.
The role will also require collaborating with project and product teams to transfer knowledge application into solutions, and actively engage with academic community.
Background
Proven experience as an ML practitioner and researcher (minimum 5+ years on exception basis we will consider those with limited experience but having exceptional math and C++ skills)
Familiarity with Face Recognition and computer vision algorithms and libraries
Proficiency in Python/C++ required
Expertise in deep learning framework including PyTorch, TensorFlow
Strong software engineering skills including Git, CI/CD, Docker
Experience in REST API and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) is a plus
Ability to explain and present analysis and machine learning concepts to a broad technical audience
MS/PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, or similar field.
Benefits
Health Care Plan
Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
Short Term & Long-Term Disability
Training & Development
Work From Home
Financial rewards for successful IP filings, and published papers
Stock Option Plan
Opportunities for international relocation and transfer

tech_stack: Outlook  Salesforce.com  Account Reconciliation  Account Management  Strategic Planning  Budgets  Accounts Payable  Advertising  Online Advertising  Auditing  Strategy  Powerpoint  Accounts Receivable  General Ledger  Accounting  Financial Analysis  Social Media Marketing  Microsoft Word  Business Development  Financial Reporting
job_description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
Founded in 2011, Empact is a leading social enterprise with a mission to build the capacity of social organisations (referred to as non-profit organisations and social enterprises) in Singapore and the region. Our aim for our capacity building efforts is to empower these social organisations to be empowered for greater impact.
Through our cross-sector collaboration with sector developers, grantmakers, corporates and volunteers, we bridge the capacity gap of the social sector by channelling talents, skills and resources to co-create innovative solutions to address the various needs of social organisations.
To date, Empact has impacted and empowered more than 2,000 social organisations in the region, with a contribution of savings amounting up to $9 million worth of professional services that have been rendered pro bono for the social sector.
In 2019, Empact was selected as a finalist for the President's Challenge Social Enterprise of the Year Award. This is the highest accolade for social enterprises in Singapore by the President of Singapore.
RESPONSIBILITIES
In our Shared Services department, we empower non-profits and social enterprises by providing affordable and professional services that are critical for their daily operations, such as bookkeeping, donation tracking, accounting to payroll and human resources support. By bridging this gap, we believe our social organisations are enabled to fulfil their social missions and scale their social impact.
We are currently looking for a Senior / Accounts Executive, who will be responsible for assigned client portfolio and Internal Finance/Admin portfolio. You will be working together with our Client Services Managers / Assistant Managers / Executives, and guiding our interns and volunteers to provide accounting, HR, and financial process improvement services to our non-profit and social enterprise clients.
Roles and Responsibilities
Your job role will cover:
External client-facing scope:
Maintaining a good client relationship with our Shared Services clients and ensuring on time delivery of services
Performing accounting, financial reporting, payroll, GST, tax and other shared services functions for our clients
Attending to clients accounting / audit queries and requests in a timely and professional manner
Guiding volunteers and interns for delivery of services and problem-solving
Assisting in ad-hoc Shared Services projects (financial process improvement projects)
Internal finance/admin scope:
Supporting internal finance team in finance-related tasks (AR, AP, vendor & staff claims payment processing, bookkeeping, management reporting, GST reporting, tax computation)
Supporting in sales invoicing to clients
Supporting in payroll processing and IR8A tax filing
Ensuring proper documentation of accounting files
Assisting in other ad-hoc finance/admin tasks (grant claims preparation, budgeting, vendor liaison, office space management)
QUALIFICATIONS
At least a Diploma in Accountancy or related discipline
Min 1-2 years working experience in the areas of accounting and financial reporting; audit experience will be advantageous
Experienced in client-facing tasks and preparing full set of accounts
Proficient and patient in communicating financial principles to stakeholders with no accounting background
Familiar with cloud-based accounting and HR software; interested in constantly learning new skills
Good interpersonal skills with a positive disposition
Exhibit good ability to work as team
Ability to multitask and adaptable to change
Generally tech savvy and proficient in Microsoft applications
OTHER INFORMATION
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU
Empact offers competitive remuneration within the social sector, and comprehensive benefits that include medical and dental benefits. We have flexible work arrangements to allow you to manage both work and personal commitments. In addition, we have flexible reporting hours and 4 days of Work from Home per month for all eligible staff.
We also believe in investing in our staff and their professional development through training and supervision. We offer our staff a free bespoke training that will be helpful to develop them in their respective roles.
WHAT'S IT LIKE WORKING AT EMPACT
We have remarkable clients and partners, both domestically and internationally, who are working towards supporting social causes around the world
We have a staff engagement programme, including regular team-building activities, fitness and volunteering sessions
Our office is located in the heart of the city (CBD area) and accessible by public transport. Nearest MRT station is Tanjong Pagar with a 3-min walk to the office
Located within a wide range of food choices and a place perfect for taking meetings outside, exercising and strolling
Our team consists of passionate and multi-talented people of diverse backgrounds and social cause interests
Together, we are inspired to bring more awareness of skill-based volunteering and enhance the capabilities of social organisations. We also adopt an open communication and collaborative workplace, making it a great venue to make an impact
HOW TO JOIN OUR TEAM
If you are someone that fits the requirements, and if purpose/meaning in what you do at work important, send us your CV and a thoughtful cover letter. Your cover letter should express why you are interested in working for Empact and your qualifications. At Empact, we value diversity and inclusion, and we look forward to reviewing applications from all who are qualified to apply. Please also state the following information:
Current & expected salary
Reason(s) for leaving
Availability to commence work
Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - Empact

job_description:
Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation.
What you will do
The enterprise Information Technology field is rapidly changing. The explosion of data tied to the ubiquity of digital technologies and services available to consumers is changing the expectations of senior leaders, employees, customers, and patients. People want access to information, everywhere, on any device, anytime. These challenges require IT to significantly uplift its technology assets and skillsets to speed up and drive the changes. To address this challenge, IT has established a three-hub model in Singapore, Branchburg, NJ and Prague, CZ to provide a follow-the-sun operational model leveraging networked teams that can better support the business, and our mission to improving patients lives, utilizing an agile mindset, and resulting in cross-regional work across the hubs.
IT Collaboration Services seeks a candidate for the Video Product Service Team to provide expert level technical abilities for administration of our company's videoconferencing tools with platforms such as Teams, WebEx, and Zoom. The Unified Communications (UC) Video Engineer will focus on design, operation, and management of Microsoft Team rooms and is responsible for leading the growth, administration, configuration, troubleshooting and integrity of unified communications services and related components, extending from on-premises to those in M365 tenant or other cloud services. You will work with the Product Owner and Engineering team to support and implement Microsoft Teams Roadmap. You will provide technical and subject matter expertise for M365 services concentration in Microsoft Teams and other UC video related tools.
What you must have
To be successful in this role you must have:
Education level:

Knowledge and hands on experience and support with Cisco, Poly, Crestron, and Microsoft MTR equipment

Preferred Experience and Skills:
Experience with Microsoft Teams Rooms strongly preferred
At least 5 years in a video conferencing role including meeting and event support
Experience with video collaboration services and technologies from vendors such as: Poly, Cisco, MS Teams, Crestron, WebEx, Zoom, etc.

tech_stack: Networking  Employer Branding  Talent Acquisition  Social Media  Interpersonal Skills  Recruiting  ATS  Team Player  Screening  Sourcing
job_description:
The Tricentis Talent Acquisition team plays a critical role in the growth of Tricentis by finding and hiring great people to help reach and achieve our goals. We are the brand ambassadors of our culture, act as strategic partners to the business and are focused on creating a great experience for each and every candidate as well as our key stakeholders.

Tricentis is looking for an experienced Senior Recruiter to support our growth. This person will attract top talent across a variety of business units, as well as build relationships with candidates and hiring managers. We work hard, but we have lots of fun doing it. If a cool, collaborative, and challenging work environment sounds appealing, you'll fit right in.

What You'll Do
Partner with business leaders to understand and identify talent acquisition needs and opportunities
Drive end-to-end recruitment process such as identifying selection criteria, posting of job advertisements, sourcing, screening, interviewing candidates and negotiating offers in cooperation with hiring managers.
Develop and implement appropriate sourcing strategies for the different markets.
Manage recruiting process through our applicant tracking system and update and maintain weekly requisition reporting.
Proactively further expand sourcing strategy by developing and driving a variety of sourcing channels such as engaging on social media, participation at networking events, conferences and career fairs.
Develop and implement strategies to attract technical talent and drive pipeline growth.
Lead vendor relationship management with external partners and/or 3rd party agencies.
Develop and implement key recruitment metrics such as supply and demand and local market compensation analysis.
Contribute to the development and improvement of our Talent Acquisition/HR services by identifying best practices and continuous process improvement.
Develop and support the further development and enhancement of our employer branding strategy initiatives.

Who You Are
You have 7+ years of full life cycle recruiting experience in a Recruiter/Talent Acquisition role with preferred corporate experience at a multi-national/global technology company.
You have a passion for technology and strong technical acumen and familiarity with emerging technologies (i.e. modern application languages and Cloud architecture frameworks)
You have the ability to build, manage and sustain a volatile volume of open positions across the company.
You have demonstrated experience in sourcing candidates through all possible sourcing strategies such as social media, networking, cooperation with external partners, university engagement.
You have a passion for great candidate and customer experience.
You are very comfortable working in a fast-paced, metrics-driven environment with multiple competing priorities.
You are a team player with a winning attitude and strong consultative communication skills.
You have a strong proficiency with ATS systems and best practices (i.e. SmartRecruiters, Workday, etc.)
Additional Information:

We Offer
Market conform salary + success-oriented bonus
Favorable working atmosphere in a rapidly expanding company
Personal and professional development
Variety of career opportunities and a wide range of tasks
Permanent, full-time employment
This is a rare and highly sought-after opportunity to be part of a highly talented technical support team within Tricentis. If you are interested in the opportunity to become a member of Tricentis where your ideas count, apply now for immediate consideration.

Tricentis is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran.

job_description:
Motional is a driverless technology company making self-driving vehicles a safe, reliable, and accessible reality.
The Motional team is made up of engineers, researchers, innovators, dreamers and doers, who together are creating a first-of-its-kind technology with the potential to transform the way we move. We're behind some of the industry's largest leaps forward, including the first fully-autonomous cross-country drive in the U.S, the launch of the world's first robotaxi pilot, and operation of the world's most-established public robotaxi fleet.
As a leader in an emerging industry that has the promise of creating safer, more reliable and accessible transportation for all, it's imperative we have a diverse workforce, create an inclusive culture, and understand the communities we operate in around the world.
Strategically formed by Hyundai Motor Group and Aptiv, Motional is fundamentally changing how people move through their lives. Headquartered in Boston, Motional has operations in the U.S and Asia. For more information, visit www.Motional.com and follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.
About this position
We are seeking a talented Senior Backend Software Engineer to help develop and roll out the next generation of our advanced tools to support autonomous driving. We are building a suite of fleet management products to enable the successful operation of our Autonomous Vehicles at scale. The core of the Fleet Autonomy Services (FAS) platform is built around our real-time data pipeline which enables our AVs to communicate with our cloud services. Our team develops products such as real-time monitoring platform for the AV fleet, vehicle software update services, and integrations with ride hailing partners.
What You'll Be Doing
Design, build and maintain our FAS platform for our autonomous vehicle fleet
Write high quality, maintainable code
Assist with high-level analysis, design, and code reviews
Communicate with stakeholders and other team leads to identify system requirements
Manage product delivery timelines
Hands-on implementation of key portions of the system
What We're Looking For
5+ years of professional work experience as a software engineer in designing and building distributed systems
Experience with serverless architectures
Experience building systems using SQL and NoSQL databases
Strong written and oral communication skills
MS, BS or BA in Computer Science / Engineering
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, continuous delivery environment
Experience with Amazon Web Services, Docker, and Terraform
Bonus Points (not required)
Experience with IoT infrastructure
Experience with Python / Golang
Experience with JavaScript / React / Redux

job_description:
Rakuten Group, Inc. is the largest e-commerce company in Japan, and third largest e-commerce marketplace company worldwide, with over 1.5 billion registered users worldwide. The Rakuten brand is recognized worldwide for its leadership and innovation, and provides a variety of consumer and business-focused services including e-commerce, e-reading, travel, banking, securities, credit card, e-money, portal and media, online marketing and professional sports. The company is expanding globally and currently has operations throughout Asia, Western Europe, and the Americas.
Rakuten Viki is a premier global entertainment streaming site where millions of people discover and consume primetime shows and movies subtitled in more than 200 languages, by our community of fans. With billions of videos viewed and more than 1 billion words translated, Viki brings global entertainment to fans everywhere!
Based in Singapore, reporting to the Director of Engineering, the Engineering Manager, SRE role is a technical management position that requires you to have depth in the area you are guiding the team in.
About the SRE Team:
The SRE team at Viki is responsible for building infrastructure for the large distributed components that run Viki. We develop and maintain services that power Viki's API and business intelligence, as well as make architecture changes to scale them. We handle everything from Performance engineering, Cost optimisation, Security, Reliability engineering to Configuration and deployment pipelines. We run our systems on GCP with GKE and our media pipeline on AWS. We also use Spinnaker, Cloudbuild, ELK, PostgreSQL, Redis to name a few tools. You don't have to be familiar with all of them, as long as you have built expertise with something equivalent. You will help us continuously improve our system, scale it to the next level and create guidelines for developers to follow.
Key Responsibilities Include:
Be accountable from a delivery and people management perspective for a team that designs, builds and maintains infrastructure services across Viki's platform
Run Incident Management, Capacity Planning and SLO definition with various stakeholders and feedback lessons to the planning cycle and development processes.
Instill a sense of current SRE principles into various development teams around reliability, performance, security.
Run SRE team planning. Conduct and track Quarterly and yearly roadmapping, Biweekly Sprint planning for the team.
Own the cloud infrastructure, observability suite and Pagerduty setup in all aspects. Liaison with development teams, 3rd party support teams, TAMs and create the functional roadmap for the same.
Requirements:
Passion to build scalable systems and deliver top-tier services with impact worldwide
We don't require experience in any particular technology, but you should have the ability to chew through difficult technical problems and gain insights from them
A solid foundation in understanding of practical operating system concepts around Linux/ Unix and grasp of basic networking are essential
Familiarity with Docker / Kubernetes or any equivalent systems is a must.
Familiarity with either AWS or GCP or Azure is a must
Experience in scaling systems or working with high scale systems is a must
Should have had experience managing people in some capacity
Rakuten is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status. Women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged

tech_stack: Etl  Data Quality  data engineering  Sql  Python  Data Warehousing  Business Requirements  Warehousing  Leadership  Business Intelligence  Pipelines  Upstream  Versatility  metadata
job_description:
Role overview
AlphaLab Capital is a leading provider of technology for quantitative trading. Each day, our infrastructure and algorithms enable traders to supply billions of dollars of liquidity to major exchanges around the globe. We are looking for a senior data engineer to play a pivotal role in how we digest, store, and process market and internal business data. You will work closely with our co-founders to leverage data to drive and improve our trading and business decisions.

As the lead data engineer, you will be responsible for developing a data platform that allows our teams to create operational data pipelines, conduct ad hoc data exploration, and serve structured data to end users. You will collaborate with stakeholders to understand the market and business processes that generate the data, the frequency and latency with which these need to be ingested, and the transformations that need to be applied. You will also be responsible for providing infrastructure that makes our vast amounts of data accessible and efficient to query so our teams know what information is available and can make the best data-driven decisions. You are a self-starter and are comfortable working cross-functionally with other teams.
Summary of key responsibilities
Work closely with the trading, engineering, and business teams to understand external and our internal sources of data and translate this understanding into business requirements for the data platform
Turn these requirements into technical design for scalable data pipelines/ETL processes using modern tools and best practices (including selection of said tools), leveraging existing infrastructure as appropriate
Design and develop efficient data storage and query infrastructure to support internal analytics and trade optimization needs
Build support for metadata in the data platform in order to expose data lineage, a data dictionary, and other appropriate documentation
Ensure data ingested into pipelines are of high quality and processes are in place to detect and address any changes in or issues arising from third party sources and/or upstream operational tables
Design business intelligence infrastructure and interfaces to improve availability and usability of data and insights, including selection and maintenance of tooling (e.g., AuroraDB, Grafana, etc.)
Work with company leadership and business teams to review utilization of data and plan for future needs
Partner with and clearly communicate results to influence leaders and key decision-makers
Ideal qualifications
At least 7 years of experience in data engineering with a focus on building data pipelines and platform infrastructure
Degree in engineering or a related technical field with an interest in the digital asset space
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python
Advanced knowledge of data warehousing concepts and schema optimization based on usage patterns in a data-heavy environment
Experience in developing ETL processes, managing scheduling, and implementing data quality checks
Prior experience with creating data storage and query infrastructure as well as business intelligence tooling for data producers and consumers
Hands-on experience with cloud-based data infrastructure and warehousing solutions, preferably in AWS and/or GCP
Experience with Airflow, dbt, or other similar data tooling is a plus
Ability to work cross-functionally, build trust with internal stakeholders, derive business requirements, and translate these into technical specifications
Excellent communication skills with strong market intuition and ability to understand complex business systems, versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job
Compensation & Benefits
Competitive salary based on experience
Participation in company bonus pool
Daily catered lunch
Health insurance and wellness benefits
Unlimited vacation policy

job_title: Manager - Tanzu Labs Platform Services - Opportunity for Working Remotely
job_description:
VMware Tanzu Labs Platform Services

Us

Ready to build So are we. Come join VMware's new exciting Modern Applications Business Unit (MAPBU) team, made up of products and services under the Tanzu portfolio to help customers build, run, and manage their most important applications. To learn more about Tanzu watch this #TeamTanzu

You

You have a strong passion for leading teams to deliver world-class customer outcomes. You value and foster diversity and inclusion and have previous people management experience with proven ability to motivate and coach diverse teams to optimize performance. You have the ability to manage change effectively. You are a problem solver and the thought of collaborating with a team to help organizations transform to meet the challenges of tomorrow excites you. You are an expert negotiator, enjoy working with other people, and are motivated by creating lightbulb moments for the people you work with.
Summary

Recruit, manage, and develop an amazing team of consultants while helping to shape thought leadership in our industry. Support VMware customer engagements by providing delivery leadership through a world class Platform Engineering and Cloud Native Transformation consultancy. Drive great customer experiences and contribute to the operations of a responsible, and profitable consultancy practice.

Key Responsibilities

The amount of time you spend on any of the following responsibilities may change depending on the needs of the business.
People Management

Define and monitor progress on employee development plans and goals for 5 - 10 direct reports (including establishing and tracking goals, encouraging professional development opportunities and holding regular career conversations)

Actively involved in discussions and decisions on performance management, talent reviews, compensation and equity recommendations, promotions and more.

Regularly collect and synthe feedback from and about your reports to help identify strengths and opportunities for growth of team members, and advocate for their success.

Continuously improve career development plans and career ladders with management peers, and other colleagues within the business.

Support leadership in planning for growth in new locations, new skill sets and/or roles

Partner with recruitment on hiring pipelines, both managing candidates and continuously improving the interview processes and candidate experience

Participate in annual headcount planning, and collaborate with finance and recruiting partners on recruiting activities

Responsible for onboarding new team members

Accountable to ensure direct report timesheets and expense reports are submitted and approved in weekly

Engagement Success

Responsible for engagement success and customer satisfaction

Collaborate with other leaders across MAPBU and other business units to ensure successful customer engagements

Collaborate with pre sales Solution Leads and account teams to validate customer expectations

Responsible for ensuring customer and delivery team readiness to begin engagements by driving the Iteration[0] process.

Support delivery teams in meeting customers where they are by applying our best practices, reference architectures and delivery methodologies.

Ensure continuity of customer engagements by engaging other staff for short-lived work, vacation or sick cover

Actively manage the engagement budget through weekly burn down reports and monitoring of expenses.

Expected billable hours 25%, not critical path IC work, but customer facing value.

Delivery Management

Work to expand or extend existing engagements in partnership with VMware Tanzu Labs Sales colleagues.

Continuously drive improvement within teams to increase the customer experience, drive further adoption of VMware technology and grow the VMware Tanzu Labs business

Be accountable for managing team and project health on customer engagements

Support Delivery Operations by making recommendations of staff, and discussing with those selected about upcoming engagements

Lead or participate in internal projects around improving people and practice processes

Handle customer escalations in a collaborative and empathetic way

Experience / Skills

3+ years of management experience with 5+ years of consulting experienceOR 8+ years of consulting experience with success in mentoring and leading project teams

Fluency in Cloud Native technologies and modern platform engineering practices including automation, Continuous Delivery, SRE and product mindset around Kubernetes

Ability to motivate, grow and lead consultants at various stages of their career across practices

Excellent communication, active listening and organization skills

Ability to balance a variety of tasks

Comfort in holding team members accountable for achieving their goals

Strong sense of self awareness, can relate well, learn quickly and adapt to changes while remaining calm under pressure

Our Values

values:

Execution

Passion

Integrity

Customers

Community

Our Principles

?? Empower Teams - Diverse teams with shared context, psychological safety, and decision-making authority move faster.

Start Simple - Learn just enough to begin and let the work inform the direction.

Embrace Change - Expect change and turn it into opportunity.

Deliver Early and Often - Ship value to users and measure impact to lower risk.

Improve Continuously - We are always learning and humbled by what we don't know.

?? Give Back - Share our time, tools, code, and approach with internal and open source communities to maximize impact.

job_title: Director, Technology Solutions - Partner Business, Asia Pacific & Japan
job_description:
The Director of Technology Solutions, Partner & Commercial Business, Asia Pacific & Japan is accountable for the go-to-market strategy for technology solutions via partners and Commercials. This role is regional in nature and will collaborate closely with the 5 regions in APJ. The role will report into the APJ CTO, matrix to the APJ PCO Leader and will work closely with the Partner and Commercial Business Leadership and solution teams along with other GTM functions as required. Success in the role will require strong inter-personal skills to be effective across the global and local value chain as well as strong ability to work across boundaries in a matrix organization.
The director will lead VMware's efforts to provide compelling & easily consumed solutions aligned with business outcomes in order to drive superior customer experiences within a robust partner ecosystem. The successful candidate will collaborate with VMware engineering and sales teams to evangelize new solutions and capabilities for partners, having a presence at key briefings and industry events.
The ideal candidate is a strategic business leader with strong technical acumen and proven expertise in building effective technology solutions in a highly matrixed environment. The role requires a track record of balancing strategic thinking, driving transformational change, and executional rigor delivering on current business priorities. This is a highly cross-functional role requiring close collaboration and a jointly accountable operating model between PCO & VMware speciality SE, Core SE , Enterprise architects , solutions marketing, and the Multi-Cloud and Services architect.
The director is expected to effectively influence and guide predominantly CTO or technical leaders from Strategic Partners in the way they establish their company strategies and practices and interact with VMware technical leadership.
Key responsibilities include:
Define and execute VMware's WPCO (Partner and Commercial Organization) future-ready strategy & technical vision through technical leadership in APJ e.g. through co-innovation with partners.
Responsible for leading VMware's technical scale strategy through strategic partner engagements and for ensuring clear business relationship through their technical peers
Provide thought leadership for industry-specific mature & emerging patterns build and execute industry and vertical solutions incubation framework.
Successful collaboration with sales and sales operations teams through deep understanding of field and partner organizations, including their operating models.
Influence internal and partner senior executives to drive transformation of operating model and investments with VMware.
Drive the PSA execution across APJ, so we get value from already announced change and accelerate the working model in 2020 with clearly defined scope, compensation plans, roles and responsibilities and enablement plan with consistent management and measurement.
Build an effective technical framework for practice development for our top partners to cover the customers evolving requirements as well as provide effective GTM coverage of the entire product and solution portfolio of VMware.
Be a trusted contributor, representing the partner technology solutions team in the Global and APJ WPCO Leadership Planning, Strategy and Engagements.
Proliferate global and local best practices to drive cross-geo learning and consistency in approach and execution while allowing customization to fit local context.
Build and execute a scalable APJ Partner Technology Solutions operating model, refine model as overall business and partner ecosystem evolves.

Required Experience & Skills:
15+ years experience in partner strategy & business planning and building transformational frameworks within a highly matrixed software sales environment.
Strong communication, listening, presentation, and persuasion skills with an ability to represent new ideas and concepts to executive leaders. Ability to effectively and energetically present to partners, customers, peers, and management.
Experience speaking at technology industry events.
Solid understanding of Partner operating models including ecosystem profiles, software sales cycles and customer lifecycle models.
Demonstrates exceptional leadership skills with the ability to create and drive vision across organizations.
Strong interpersonal and team building skills proven ability to work with a diverse team and influence and drive change across functional and business boundaries in a fast-paced environment.
Technical depth & understanding of partner services models (lifecycle capabilities) required to drive successful consumption and deployment partner models of VMware cloud delivered services.
Trusted advisor to sales leadership by providing/sharing key insights on a regular basis.
Perceived as a thought leader by partners through demand for strategic engagements.
The ability to operate effectively in a rapidly scaling, dynamic environment.
Be able to manage multiple stakeholders and groups simultaneously.
Possesses highest level of integrity, honesty and professionalism.
Experience working in an APJ regional capacity across the diverse APJ environment as well as with global headquarters. It is a plus if the candidate has experience working in multiple countries within APJ and/or speaks multiple Asian languages.
Excellent intellectual and analytical skills - ability to structure problem statements and be the catalyst for uncovering new ways to solve problems.
Prior management consulting, business development, or strategy & planning experiences are desired.
Comfortable in a remote team working environment self-motivated and results-oriented strong work ethic and time management skills.

Personal Characteristics and Educational Background:
.Motivation for the role
.Good at leading and driving change and takes appropriate risk(s)
.Existing C-level relationships at Strategic Partners
.Executive presence to be able to present to partner leadership teams, VMware teams on the value of strategic partners and engage as a peer with CTO of partner (or equivalent role)
.The successful candidate should expect to work flexible hours including being able to travel approx. 25-50% the time.

job_description:
As trustee of the nation's retirement savings, the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. Our CPF schemes touch our CPF members across various life stages. To enable CPF members to make informed decisions to meet their retirement, healthcare and housing needs, communication of CPF-related information and guidance in performing CPF transactions is key. The CPF website is an important vehicle to achieve this. If you are passionate about serving the public through delivering innovative and citizen-centric digital services, this will be a meaningful career for you.
Information Technology
IT systems form the backbone of our operations. We are looking for individuals with passion and IT expertise, to help us improve the delivery of our systems and services. The Board's IT systems support a high daily volume of financial transactions for CPF members. In addition to keeping the lights on, the Board also keeps pace with the external environment through innovation in its IT systems.
Responsibilities
You will be involved in the analysis, design, development, implementation, and maintenance of application systems to support the Board's scheme.
Working in tandem with a passionate team, you will be in involved in the various stages of the project SDLC to maintain and integrate IT systems including user support through troubleshooting and timely resolution to address any incidents encountered.
Requirements
Interest in software application development & support where you find joy in fixing issues with meticulous codes as well as adhering to the requirements and standards
Academic or working knowledge of a range of technologies and languages such as Java/J2EE, .Net, Pega to develop applications
Enjoy examining existing systems, identifying flaws and creating solutions to improve service uptime and time-to-resolve through monitoring and automated remediation
Good understanding of both frontend, backend and content management systems will be preferred
Ability to perform routine/scheduled maintenance of the applications
Flexible in work assignment and willing to gain experiential learning by working in diverse functions where opportunities avail
What you can expect
A challenging and rewarding career where you can contribute to national objectives
A friendly work environment with like-minded colleagues to co-create and collaborate together
A flexible schedule where work is not constrained to the office and 9-to-6 workdays
A productive yet growth-oriented workplace with flexible dress code where you are empowered to decide your appropriate outfit for the day
Position is on 2-year contract on commencement with possibility of renewal and conversion to permanent
Grow and gain valuable work experience where you can accelerate your career through promotion opportunities subject to individual performance
Comprehensive rewards package
Annual leave and pro-family leave
Medical and dental benefits
Access to recreational activities

tech_stack: Manager - ServiceNow - SG
job_description:
At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive, collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.
Work you will do
As a Manager within Cloud Engineering team, you are part of a team of creative, visionary minds of many disciplines who put future-forward thinking into projects that push the edges of technology to support the change of our clients. You will establish and nurture positive working relationships with teams and clients with the intention to exceed client expectations. You will:
Promote ServiceNow internally to sales and delivery teams to drive growth.
Be the go to person for ServiceNow Architecture. You should have a deep understanding of services offered on ServiceNow platforms and understand how to use them together to build complex solutions.
Educate customers of all s on the value proposition of ServiceNow and participate in deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment.
Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the solutions architect community.
Build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within customers to enable them to be ServiceNow advocates.

Your role as a leader
At Deloitte, we believe in the importance of empowering our people to be leaders at all levels. We expect our people to embrace and live our purpose and shared values, challenging themselves every day to identify issues that are most important to our clients, our people and the communities, and to make an impact that matters. In addition to living our purpose, Managers across our Firm are expected to:
Understand the goals of Deloitte, align our people to these objectives by setting clear priorities and direction by establishing a positive relationship with a senior stakeholders.
Influence teams and individuals positively. Lead by example and provide equal opportunity for people to grow, develop and succeed.
Delivers exceptional client service. Maximizes results and drives high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and geographies.
Manage diverse teams within a highly inclusive team culture where people are respected and valued for their contribution.
Develop high-performing teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities and recognize them for the impact that they make.

Enough about us, let's talk about you
If you are someone with:
8+ years experience in Design and Implementation of ServiceNow Automation Platform
Team player with effective interpersonal and communication skills
Demonstrated leadership and teamwork within or outside a work setting
Exceptional problem-solving ability. Logical reasoning, creative thinking, comfort with numbers, and the ability to untangle complex issues
Strong passion for consulting, ability to adapt and cope in a fast pace, challenging work hours and environment

Certifications:
ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist
ServiceNow Certified Application Developer
ServiceNow Certified System Administrator

Next Steps
So what are you waiting for Join the winning team now.
Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Application instructions: Interested applicants please apply at https://grnh.se/6a9b31002us
Workato is the only integration and automation platform that is as simple as it is powerful and because it's built to power the largest enterprises, it is quite powerful.
Simultaneously, it's a low-code/no-code platform. This empowers any user (dev/non-dev) to painlessly automate workflows across any apps and databases.
We're proud to be named a leader by both Forrester and Gartner and trusted by 7,000+ of the world's top brands such as Box, Grab, Slack, and more. But what is most exciting is that this is only the beginning.
Why join us
Ultimately, Workato believes in fostering a flexible, trust-oriented culture that empowers everyone to take full ownership of their roles. We are driven by innovation and looking for team players who want to actively build our company.
But, we also believe in balancing productivity with self-care. That's why we offer all of our employees a vibrant and dynamic work environment along with a multitude of benefits they can enjoy inside and outside of their work lives.
If this sounds right up your alley, please submit an application. We look forward to getting to know you!
Also, feel free to check out why:
Business Insider named us an enterprise startup to bet your career on
Forbes Cloud 100 recognized us as one of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world
Deloitte Tech Fast 500 ranked us as the 17th fastest growing tech company in the Bay Area, and 96th in North America
Quartz ranked us the #1 best company for remote workers
All full-time employees in Singapore will also have the following benefits:
Workato Stock Options at one of Silicon Valley's fastest growing startups
Flexible and personalized medical and wellness benefits (protection for hospitalization and surgical procedures, clinical outpatient visits, accident coverage and more...)
Up to 20 weeks of paid maternity leave, and 10 weeks of paid paternity leave
Responsibilities
We are looking for an exceptional Enterprise Account Executive (Asia) to join our growing team. In this role, you will respond to inbound enquiries and increase our outreach via outbound activities. This hire will strategically approach target companies and sell automation solutions that will help them achieve their business objectives. Our Account Executives strive to meet and exceed their quotas, but always act in the best interests of the client. Our ideal candidate is confident, tenacious and highly organized. Your responsibilities:
Own and develop accounts to expand business with enterprise companies in the Asia (Excluding Japan) market
Manage the full sales cycle by assessing sales potential and creating prospecting lists via various methods to attract enterprise customers
Develop and own relationships with existing/potential customers to understand their business, and proactively help customers leverage automation to achieve their goals
Demonstrate ability to negotiate with different levels of stakeholders and show confidence in presenting to C-suite audiences
Work with teams from multiple functions (e.g: Presales, Marketing, Customer Success etc.) to formulate plans to grow new and existing businesses.
Build a compelling partner strategy for your key accounts, engage with the channel team and lead the joint sales approach
Expedite the resolution of customer challenges to maximize satisfaction
Ensure high forecasting accuracy and consistency
Requirements
Qualifications and Experience
10+ years of Enterprise Software Sales experience in the technology space closing large SaaS or PaaS deals in Asia.
Evidence of exceeding direct sales goals of >1M
Candidate must be based in Singapore
Keen interest in technology and industry trends
Skills
Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time in high-pressure situations
Driven, self-motivated and confident delivering results in a fast-paced and flexible environment
Strong collaboration skills, comfortable in a dynamic start-up work culture with a passion for making an impact
Capability to build and maintain excellent relationships with multiple and diverse stakeholders
Strong interpersonal communication skills and ability to engage with all levels of stakeholders
Ability to confidently articulate business value and command prospect's interest
Strong critical thinking, high intellectual curiosity and analytical skills
Entrepreneurial mindset with a get things done mentality

Roles And Responsibilities
The Senior Manager - Digital Marketing, APAC will build awareness and demand through online channels. We seek an experienced, tactical, hands-on manager focused on acquiring new customers, along with supporting other initiatives requiring digital marketing expertise. This role will report to the Marketing Director, APJ.
As a B2B Enterprise digital marketing manager, you will be responsible for the conception, design, production, execution, and optimization of online marketing campaigns across multiple channels (e.g. SEM, organic/SEO, retargeting, email, webinars, etc.)
Define campaign objectives and enable effective reporting, target audiences, segment leads, and create marketing assets (website offers, email templates, landing pages, banners, etc.) to execute the campaign.
Work with cross-functional team members (Creative Design, Sales, BDR, Marketing, Finance, Product) to orchestrate high-impact integrated online marketing campaigns.
Work with the global marketing teams to optimize and localize global campaigns to ensure market relevancy.
Nurture prospects and ensure that Marketing Leads are converted to Sales Opportunities.
Ongoing project management of campaign execution across Marketo, and Salesforce, including data hygiene. Manage campaigns timeline, ROI, and data-driven improvements through optimization.
Develop custom messaging and assets as needed to drive the development of custom 1:1 account marketing programs that address specific customer challenges.
Building and delivering integrated marketing campaigns across the digital channels
Communicate campaign results to key stakeholders.
Manage marketing budgets and generate marketing ROI to drive pipeline growth
What You'll Need
8+ years exp as an experienced digital marketing practitioner with a proven tactical experience in driving demand through digital channels
Hands-on digital marketing experience, preferably for B2B SaaS across SEM, affiliate, display, and paid social
An experienced manager with a strong desire to collaborate in a supportive, accountable environment
Ability to skillfully and confidently grow the digital function to support company revenue and growth targets
Experience using multi-channel, multi-touch attribution to improve channel performance
Extensive experience with digital media planning and buying including use of programmatic buying, direct buying through Google Adwords, Bing, and Yahoo. Experience with other digital channels a plus
Deep familiarity with working with digital marketing execution platforms, agencies, content management providers, and digital analytics tools; including Google Analytics, CRM and marketing automation platforms, advertising platforms, and attribution tools
Experience successfully managing third-party digital agencies to align to company strategy and goals and meet/exceed targets

tech_stack: Version Control  MongoDB  Software Engineering  MySQL  Javascript  Dynamodb  Ruby  Docker  Java  Databases  Software Development  vocal  Reliability  Advocacy  Articulate  ab testing
job_description:
Coinbase has built the world's leading compliant cryptocurrency platform serving over 68 million accounts in more than 100 countries. With multiple successful products, and our vocal advocacy for blockchain technology, we have played a major part in mainstream awareness and adoption of cryptocurrency. We are proud to offer an entire suite of products that are helping build the cryptoeconomy and increase economic freedom around the world.
There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for signals that a candidate will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, disrupt ourselves, and expect sustained high performance because we play as a championship team. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people with the desire and capacity to build and share expertise in the frontier technologies of crypto and blockchain, in whatever way is most relevant to their role.
Coinbase is seeking experienced backend engineers to join our team to build out the next generation of crypto-forward products and features. You will solve unique, large scale, highly complex technical problems, bridging the constraints posed by web-scale applications and blockchain technology. You will help build the next generation of systems to make cryptocurrency accessible to everyone across the globe, operating real-time applications with high frequency, low latency updates, and managing the most secure, dockerized infrastructure running in the cloud.
What you'll be doing:
Build new services to meet critical product and business needs using Golang.
Design scalable systems to solve novel problems with modern cloud technology and industry best practices.
Articulate a long term vision for maintaining and scaling our backend systems and the teams running them.
Work with engineers, designers, product managers and senior leadership to turn our product and technical vision into a tangible roadmap every quarter.
Write high quality, well tested code to meet the needs of your customers.
What we look for in you:
You have at least 5 years of experience in software engineering.
You've designed, built, scaled and maintained production services, and know how to compose a service oriented architecture.
You write high quality, well tested code to meet the needs of your customers.
You're passionate about building an open financial system that brings the world together.
Nice to haves:
You have gone through a rapid growth in your company (from startup to mid-size).
Experience with growth experiments or A/B testing frameworks.
You have experience with Blockchain technology (such as Bitcoin, Ethereum etc..)
You have experience decomposing a large monolith into microservices.
You've worked with Golang, Ruby, Docker, Rails, Postgres, MongoDB or DynamoDB.
You've built financial, high reliability or security systems.

job_title: AVP, Windows System Engineer, Technology %26 Operations

job_description:
Azure Synapse Analyticsbrings together enterprise data warehousing, observational data and big data analytics technology into a single platform that enables large scale business intelligence and machine learning solutions.
With Azure Synapse customers can build their end-to-end analytics solution with a unified experience to ingest, prepare, manage, and serve data for their business intelligence and machine learning needs.
We are part of the Azure Data team, building highly scalable distributed systems for data analytics on Azure. We believe in diversity of perspectives, establishing long-term relationships, taking pride in what we do and continuous learning. Azure is growing at a phenomenal pace with Data and AI at the center of how organizations are transforming through the cloud.
Azure Data Services group is hiring experienced Senior Program Manager that share our passion to help customers build and modernize their analytics platforms on the cloud. We are looking for a highly motivated individual with strong technical skills in big data, customer orientation, analytical background and exceptional cross-group and cross-geo collaboration skills. In this role, you willdrive theecosystem activity around the Kusto technology andwork with large Microsoft customers to realize big data analytics scenarios using Azure Synapse Data Explorer and support their efforts to digitally transform their business and operations.You will work with customers and partners to architect and design the solutions, proof of concepts or pilot projects to make our customers successful. Through these engagements, you will represent the voice of the customer distilling new requirements and issues into improvements for engineering teams. You will also collect patterns and lessons learned from your engagements and turn them into reference architectures, best practices and training for engineering teams and the global Azure Data Services community.
Working hands-on with prospects and customers to demonstrate value and driving success from demo to proof-of-concept to design and implementation
Capturing best-practices from engagements, field teams and engineering, and sharing with the worldwide Azure Data Services community via whitepapers, blogs, presentations, and training
Maintaining deep understanding of complementary and competitive technologies and vendors and be able to design and position a more compelling Azure Data Services based solution
Collaborating with Product Management and Development teams to continuously improve Azure Synapse Data Explorer
Assisting and advising our partner ecosystem to develop robust, high-quality solutions for customers
Organize trainings and workshops to for partner enablement and training
Be a trusted advisor to some of our largest customers and guide them in their Azure Synapse Analytics Lifecycle

This role might require travel.
at least 3 years of experience as a program manager
experience in building big data and distributed cloud systems
experience with open-source big data technologies and solutions
experience in working closely with data mining experts and big data researchers
experience in working closely with large international companies creating partnerships and strong relationships
knowledge in sql and kql (kusto query language) is preferred
passion for technology and quality with a strong customer focus
proven presentation and evangelism capabilities
excellent verbal and written communication skills
sc./ba, msc. /ma degree in computer science or a related technical discipline preferred
team player, confident and enthusiastic

Xiaomi Corporation was founded in April 2010 and listed on the Main Board of the Hong Kong Stock Exchange on July 9, 2018. Xiaomi is a consumer electronics and smart manufacturing company with smartphones and smart hardware connected by an IoT platform at its core.
Embracing our vision of Make friends with users and be the coolest company in the users hearts, Xiaomi continuously pursues innovations, high-quality user experience and operational efficiency. The company relentlessly builds amazing products with honest prices to let everyone in the world enjoy a better life through innovative technology.
Xiaomi is one of the world's leading smartphone companies. The company's market share in terms of smartphone shipments ranked no. 2 globally in the second quarter of 2021. The company has also established the world's leading consumer AIoT (AI+IoT) platform, with 374.5 million smart devices connected to its platform (excluding smartphones and laptops) as of 31 March 31, 2021, excluding smartphones and laptops. Xiaomi products are present in more than 100 countries and regions around the world.
