job_description:
In the AI CoE, we are looking at mid and long-term innovation opportunities driven by AI. A data scientist in the AI CoE will therefore focus on explorations, new business use cases for the bank and also for the conglomerate Aboitiz. This will entail collaborations internally but also with external partners to leapfrog our innovation opportunities. External partners include universities and research institutes with which we aim to publish peer-reviewed scientific papers.
You will be working with a cross-functional team to uncover solutions using data in order to uncover new business opportunities with AI, increase revenue, reduce costs, improve quality and performance, and manage risks while ensuring compliance with applicable regulation, laws, or internal guidelines of the bank.
What you'll do
Individual contributor role who should be able to exercise functional leadership over other data scientists that s/he might work with in UBP or other party
Develop a good understanding of business operations and easily translate gaps/needs to data science challenges to create quantifiable business impact
Utilize a variety of modeling tools, statistical analysis, and AI including Machine Learning, Deep Learning, NLP in developing solutions to guide business decision-making and implementation
Analyze, aggregate, and understand community behaviors, preferences, and profitability through supervised and unsupervised segmentation techniques to inform business strategies and decisions, product offerings, and community-level interventions
Facilitate the data science lifecycle from data collection to model deployment in collaboration with relevant stakeholders and partners
Incorporates sound methodology to build, validate and test ML or NLP approaches
Develop engines that synergize and optimize decisioning from product scores, propensity scores, profitability scores, cost, among other variables.
Work both independently and collaboratively with team members and stakeholders with varied background
Uses our data science platforms and cloud providers to accelerate the progress of our team's work
Contribute to the AI skill development by structured knowledge sharing
Contribute to scientific publications
Who you are
Has proven track record in developing analytical and implementation frameworks and designing tests. Multiple years of experience as data scientist is preferred.
Has knowledge of R, Python, and Machine Learning
Has excellent organizational, communication, presentation, project management and analytical skills
Preferred to have a Master's degree in Data Science/Analytics or relevant certifications

job_description:
The Academic Computing and Information Services (ACIS) at the National Institute of Education (NIE) invites suitable candidates to serve as a Senior Operations Engineer in the Infrastructure and Database Department. Preference will be given to individuals with working experience in DevOps and hybrid cloud operations.
Job Description
Manage Network Attached Storage (NAS) and Storage Area Network (SAN) for the department and Institute depending on needs. Manage backup systems for departmental and campus servers and computers.
Create and maintain data centre and storage asset, active tracking of current and future license needs and renewals of software and maintenance.
Manage day-to-day storage operations, license and maintenance renewal, allocates work to data centre technicians and ensuring tasks are completed.
Provide 1st-level technical support for the upkeep, configuration, and reliable operation of enterprise IT services running on Windows- and Linux-based servers.
Plan, design, implement, manage and maintain the server, storage and virtualised infrastructure deployed in the data centre.
Manage system availability, capacity, incident, problem resolution and asset lifecycle management.
Implement and contribute to the development of a business continuity plan, and participate in business continuity and contingency procedures and exercises.
Work on weekend occasionally for preventive maintenance and project related activities, provide on-call rotational support coverage and 24-hour response for emergencies.
Qualification & Skills
A University Degree in Computer/Electrical/Electronics Engineering or its equivalent.
2 to 3 years of hands-on experience in server, storage and virtualization management, SAN, NAS, zoning, LUN masking, NFS, CIFS and replication technologies.
Experience in ISO 22301 Business Continuity Management System and ISO 27001 Information Security Management System are preferred.
Certifications such as CITPM, PMP, VCP, ITIL and CCNA are preferred.
Self-motivated team player with positive attitude and ability to work independently.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Good communication, interpersonal and presentation skills.
Closing Date
The closing date of the advertisement is 23 March 2022. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Other Information
NIE staff can take chartered buses at their own expense from or near their homes to NIE campus. This is subject to the availability of seats.

job_description:
About Standard Chartered
We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.
To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.
We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.
The Role Responsibilities

The Technology Hive Lead, Advisory & Client Engagement (ACE), is responsible for the delivery of technology solutions to support the Wealth Management agenda for advisory solutions and client enablement. This role owns the technology roadmap working in alignment with business&rsquos strategic agenda to ensure adherence to overall architecture principles. The role provides technical strategy and leadership for all capabilities owned by the function ensuring that all systems are robust, scalable and resilient to support business growth.
Strategy

Lead and implement the vision, strategy and technology solution for key Wealth Management client enablement journeys driving change on transformation agenda and support the overall architecture strategy.

Work with Hive lead to derive client focused technology roadmap and capabilities

Work in collaboration with Advisory business by ensuring the delivery agenda is well executed within allocated investment funding to achieve the business outcome.

Lead and manage the delivery agenda with client centric approach to deliver business value.

Work with group and regional stakeholders to derive delivery strategy that is aligned with the overall Wealth Management business strategy

Drive transformation of A&WM businesses to adopt scaled agile delivery through the new Ways of Working (nWOW) operating model.

Build out a strong engineering team and lead the move to transform A&WM Technology Teams into a fully Agile software development organisation

Ownership towards improving the cost efficiency of the hive by increasing the offshore footprint of the hive delivery teams


Business

Deliver ACE systems&rsquo capabilities with modernized technology and quicker time to market.

Ensure the key focus areas of the delivery remain on the prioritised scope of work

Deliver hive benefits on time and within budget whilst adhering to organizational quality standards

Develop and maintain an integrated portfolio plan with effective change management discipline

Manage the dependencies, risk and issue across hive initiatives with workable resolution to deliver target capabilities.

Define the solution delivery approach that is cost efficient to optimize business value.

Drive change and adoption of new technology & delivery model with Agile, Dev Ops, Cloud first and identify working opportunities on innovation.

Strong and effective stakeholder management and communication skills.


Processes

Drive adoption of best practices, technology standards and methodologies

Provide inputs, support and challenge process or operating model to constantly identify opportunities on simplification and delivery efficiency.

Effective vendor management skills. Be able to contribute actively in negotiation conversation with external vendors to bring value for the bank and achieve service excellence.

Develop opportunities for process standardization and efficiency across the ACE delivery portfolio

Establish an effective mechanism for ensuring regular and transparent dialogue with vendors Adopt a partnership approach to promote team work, problem solving and risk sharing

Oversee and optimise the ACE hive application delivery plans from start to end, involving deadlines, milestones and processes


People and Talent


Build and maintain a highly technical resource model that focuses on the right talent skillset and expertise to optimize for speed and quality

Attract, develop, retain and promote talent within the teams following the prevailing location strategy

Provide leadership that establishes common goals around a shared vision and fosters teamwork

Cultivate a high performing team that demonstrates SCB&rsquos core values.

Coach and mentor team members on learning, career development and opportunities to help the bank achieve a strong engineering culture

Build and leverage an internal bank-wide network to facilitate and expedite delivery of the role responsibilities


Risk Management

Identify, manage and mitigate risk that would impact the overall portfolio success, driving discussion with stakeholders with agreed mitigation and action plans.

Support organization transition and define right operation model for team to deliver outcome whilst operating on changing environments.

Own the technology estate and actively identify and manage (with the Hive Leads) the risks around obsolescence, ICS, technical debt and overall application health


Governance

Ensure hive operations and activities adhere to Bank&rsquos Service Delivery Framework, guidelines and internal policies

Effective at brokering relationships with stakeholders that are both within and outside the hive

Regular and accurate representation of the hive status and activities at MPR/QPR and other governance forums

Work with program management office and 2nd line of defence teams to ensure portfolio governance are well managed.

Ensure conduct values, practices are strictly adhered to by teams (eLearning completion, DLP prevention etc)


Regulatory & Business Conduct

Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group&rsquos Values and Code of Conduct.

Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.

Lead to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank&rsquos Conduct Principles: Fair Outcomes for Clients Effective Financial Markets Financial Crime ComplianceThe Right Environment.

Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.


Key Stakeholders

Private Banking CEO

Wealth Management CEO


Other Responsibilities

Provide close vendor management for all vendors that are engaged as partners to the hive, along with all contract negotiations


Promote a healthy delivery focused culture within the hive teams by way of delegation and accountability-based role distribution



Our Ideal Candidate


Scrum Alliance Certified Scrum Product Owner

Project Management Professionals (PMP)


Looking for a leader with 10+ years of experience

Drive change and adoption of new technology & delivery model with Agile, Dev Ops, Cloud first and identify working opportunities on innovation

Must have software development, technology architecture or equivalent technical / engineering experience

Work in collaboration with Advisory business by ensuring the delivery agenda is well executed within allocated investment funding to achieve the business outcome.

Identify system and process gaps, provide suggestions during the design stage.
Understanding of installing, configuring and maintaining the endpoint and network security products for the overall performance and stability.
Ability to communicate in an intelligent and succinct manner, demonstrate strong problem-solving skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with a strong focus on customer service and solution ownership.

Certifications in McAfee products (preferred).
Certifications in Microsoft and/or Unix OS.
Certifications in network e.g.: Cisco CCNA and CCNP.
Exposure to security software solutions like Endpoint Security, Firewall, Content Security, Intrusion prevention, Web & Email Security, Encryption, Data Protection, Vulnerability Management and Compliance & Audit.
Certifications in cloud AWS or Azure

job_description:
JP Morgan Chase is looking for a candidate with solid SIEM experience and can work collaboratively with other SIEM engineers and diverse end users. Candidates will architect, implement, and use Splunk solutions to integrate data feeds and create content in a distributed computing environment. This role requires the ability to architect and implement SIEM solutions in support of cybersecurity analysts and data scientists. The focus of this role is primarily on developing, maintaining, enhancing and automating SIEM in a large scale environment deployed on systems running on Linux and Windows platforms.
Responsibilities
Architect, engineer, implement, and administer SIEM solutions in a highly available, redundant, distributed computing environment.
Perform SIEM/Splunk component deployment, configuration and troubleshooting across a variety of platforms both on-premises and in public clouds.
Optimize the operation and performance of Splunk Indexers, Search Heads and Forwarders and other SIEM related technologies used for Cyber Defense.
Integrate data feeds (logs) into SIEM/Splunk from on-premises and cloud deployed devices and applications.
Develop SIEM content and support other content developers using your expert knowledge of SPL.
Support and enhance cutting-edge machine-learning-based security analytics Splunk applications deployed on Splunk Enterprise Security.
Monitor Splunk internal logs to identify and resolve potential performance issues
Automate frequently used process and work flows with scripts and programs utilizing your development skills.
Create technical documentation including SOP's and design documents related to system configurations, processes, and procedures.
Requirements
BS/BA degree or equivalent qualification
Minimum 5 years of IT experience in a technical position as an engineer, architect or system administrator within a large scale mission critical enterprise environment
At least 5 years of direct hands-on experience installing, configuring and administering SIEM tools
Proficiency with Linux platforms, including shell scripting. Red Hat preferred. Bash preferred
Experience deploying, configuring and maintaining Splunk at scale
Experience writing complex SPL queries for dashboards, reports and apps
Experience developing custom Splunk apps for end users
Experience automating repetitive and error prone operations with scripting language.
Working knowledge of network infrastructure components (switches, routers, firewalls, proxies, load balancers, etc.)
Team oriented with great communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work on all aspects of large-scale projects including planning, prioritizing, executing, delivering, and sustaining
Experience working in an Agile environment using Scrum or Kanban methods
Preferred/Desired Skills
Certified Splunk Power User, Administrator, Architect and/or Architect II
Experience with additional logging/data pipeline technologies such as ELK, LogStash, Spark, Kafka, Fluentd, AWS Kinesis, etc.
Experience deploying and developing content for Splunk Enterprise Security.
Experience automating workflows with Splunk Phantom.
Profession experience developing software using C#, Java, Python or similar languages.
Experience developing for and deploying to Public Cloud, AWS preferred. Certification a plus.
Working knowledge of machine learning concepts and experience with one or more ML platforms or toolkits.

job_description:
We are looking for a sharp, dedicated individual who is a self-starter that enjoys strategic problem solving and guiding client requirements. Digging into the details and strong communication skills will be keys to success within this role.
You will deliver a blueprint of the enterprise that provides a common understanding of the capabilities required.
You will also engage, collaborate, and partner with various leaders and executive stakeholders to understand long and short-term business strategies, assess current & target capability maturity as input into prioritization and investment decisions, provide thought leadership, and engage in proactive business capability planning to enable our strategic business priorities, intended business outcomes, and values.
The Job:
Drive and facilitate the right discussions with business leaders to identify business capabilities in relation to current and future business objectives
Lead, build, manage, enhance business capability model along maturity/optimization framework to drive enablement of the longer-term roadmap
Partner in the strategic planning process by providing input to the scope definition of strategic initiatives leveraging capabilities, creating capability heatmaps to provide visibility to impacts, dependencies, overlaps, and opportunities.
Presents recommendations and solutions clearly and concisely and can focus on key points to portray the intended message or purpose
Advocate and drive adoption of best practices to ensure standardization of business architecture outputs across the enterprise
Takes an active role in enterprise portfolio investment strategies by assessing and rationalizing proposed enterprise capabilities
Business thinking and highly strategic to define practical solutions that align with corporate strategy
Work closely and guide the technical/development teams in software design, development, testing, and ensure successful implementation of enterprise applications
Effectively manage priorities, deliverables, and timelines with little need for escalation
Your Profile:
Extensive experience in delivering enterprise applications, preferable from a vendor environment.
3+ years experience as an Enterprise Architect
Demonstrated track record of leading within complex organizations requiring strong influence management skills - the ability to work cooperatively at all levels in a matrix environment
Strong facilitation skills and experience in managing senior stakeholder relationships, partnerships, and interactions
Exceptional collaboration, listening, written and verbal communication skills with the ability to facilitate strategic business strategy, capability, and architecture conversations with all stakeholders (management, business users, and technology resources)
Current knowledge of industry best practices for enterprise architecture
Self-starter with high motivation and passion who thrives in an ever-changing, fast-paced business environment with the ability to adapt to change
Strong leadership, confidence, and influencing skills. High level of executive presence.
Strong understanding of Agile driven development, Product model & bias towards action
Must be proficient on the following: Java, C#, Python, etc.
Frameworks: Spring, Hibernate, JavaScript, jQuery, Angular
Application Architectures: Web, Mobile, Desktop, Microservice, Cloud
Tools & Standards: Coding Conventions, Design Patterns, Best Practices
RDBMS: Oracle, Oracle Golden Gate, Data Lake, DB2, MySQL
Methodologies: Agile and Waterfall
Experienced in delivering applications using Cloud Technology: Azure, Docker, Kafka, Kubernetes, Splunk
Able to conduct training/mentoring to teams in system architecture and software engineering

Reporting to the Head of QA, the QA Engineer will be responsible for analysing requirements and executing test cycles of our platform and to build a fully automated, performant testing pipeline. They are expected to be diligent and effective in assessing risk and impact and to produce plans to address and mitigate identified risks. They will have a track record of correctly selecting automated or manual testing techniques as appropriate for the individual test case and be experienced in working across an entire platform implementation with a willingness to deeply understand and own particular areas. They will have experience working in enterprise software firms where releases and software development lifecycles are the backbones of their work. The majority of their engineering experience will be from working in agile environments where software engineers, testers, product managers and DevOps work closely together

The QA team is responsible for the overall quality of our software

Experience with libraries supporting automation testing (Selenium Webdriver, WebdriverIO, jUnit, TestNG, RestAssured, Mocha, Chai, UnitTest, Pytest, etc)

job_title: Markets Operations – FX, Money Market and Fixed Income Senior Operations Manager
tech_stack: Machine Learning  Natural Language Processing  Coaching  Mentoring  Leadership  Business Intelligence  Brokerage  Career Development  Risk Management  Audit Compliance  Strategy  Compliance  Digitization  Money Market  tactical  retirement
job_description:
Organization Overview:
Citi Markets Operations is currently at a pivotal point in its evolution and journey to implement a target operating model. We take pride and are passionate about our People and our culture. We are invested in our People and their development. We are transforming and simplifying our operating model, creating an exciting environment which encourages diversity of thought and inclusion.
We are a dynamic, global, and diverse Organisation, with a presence in over 60 Countries; covering all front post execution Operations teams including product aligned Middle Office groups, Settlements, Margin, Asset Servicing, Listed Derivative& Commodities Operations. We support an extensive range of Capital Markets products and services including Fixed Income (FX, Rates, Credit, Muni, Cash and Derivatives) where Citi is consistently a dominant top 3 player in the market, Equity (Cash, Derivatives, Prime Brokerage, Futures, Listed Derivs, FXPB) where Citi has a significant growth program to continue to build out its capabilities and services; and Syndicates where we support both FI and EQ new issues and IPOs.
Our Operations groups are core to the success of the Markets business and have significant impact across the lifecycle of a trade. We partner extensively with a range of internal stakeholders including Front Office Sales and Trading Desks, Compliance, Legal, Finance and HR; alongside having significant interaction with our external client base, playing a key role in the overall client experience. We have a Client relationship group, dedicated to overseeing the Organizational service performance and strategic partnership for our top tier client base, where we play a key role in supporting our global clients to ensure they have a first-class experience when doing business with Citi.
Our Business Intelligence and Process Re-engineering group works alongside our Operations teams delivering automation solutions to solve for operational challenges. We partner with Citi's innovation labs to drive optimization, and overall play a pivotal role in enabling us to transform to achieve our target operating model.
Our Technology partners develop and implement a wide range of applications that support the Operations, Change, Design and Implementation groups in providing innovative products and solutions. We have re-imagined how to provide technology and service in our domain through the alignment of our team vision, culture, and aggressive retirement plan for legacy applications and adoption of a micro-based containerized cloud environment. We encourage our people to create, explore and be adventurous whilst taking measured risk, adopting safe practices to protect the firm. Data lineage and optimization is core to how we develop our eco system. We are growing our capabilities using artificial intelligence, natural language processing and machine learning.
Our roles entail ensuring we operate in a robust control environment, whilst in a fast-paced workplace. We comply with global regulations and internal policies and adopt a proactive approach to identifying opportunities to reduce risk through the continuous evaluation of our controls; to protect our clients, the firm, and our reputation.
We work closely with our external global peers, partners, and regulators, and play an integral part in leading an agenda at the forefront to optimize and streamline processes and drive strategy across our industry.
Job Purpose:
Reporting into Singapore Markets Ops Senior Leadership Team, the primary responsibility of this Senior Operations Manager will beProactive engagement with Singapore country and APAC regional stakeholders (Business, Technology, Finance/PCG, Operations) in order to support the business and clients trading in Markets products, including but not limited to FX, Money Markets and Fixed Income.
Drive and implement sustainable processes, automation/migration initiatives, and standard adherence to policies.
Working very closely with Operations Control on developing and adhering to an effective control framework that fully meets Audit, Compliance and Regulatory requirements; delivery of periodic presentations to external regulators as required.
Involvement in shaping/building standardized and sustainable operational workflow and service standards for new product/production variations launches by APAC FXLM business. ie. NPAC process.
Ensuring robust infrastructure and tools (Dashboards, MIS, Alerts etc.) are in place to effectively manage risk and service our clients to a high standard.
Involved in preparing & publishing strong MIS information for regular Management Updates
High level of focus on digitization, automation and elimination of manual touch points (MTP).
People Agenda:
Implementing a successful People and Engagement strategy to help attract, develop, retain and recognize a diverse and talented global workforce
Promoting a culture of continuous improvement and cultivating a robust service and control environment
Engaging with and leading our People. Developing effective and diverse teams across a global footprint
Coaching and mentoring our People. Ensuring effective one to one discussion. Providing direction, feedback, support, and encouragement for career development
Championing diversity and inclusion to create a working environment which allows our People to thrive and excel
Qualifications and Skills:
Degree or equivalent work experience preferred
7-10+ years of experience in Tier 1 global financial institutions including extensive experience in handling large projects delivering operational activities, especially in FX, Money Market, Fixed Income products.
Experience delivering strategic change programmes spanning multiple years in a fast paced, large global financial services firm, ideally in an operations organisation
Energetic, flexible, collaborative, and proactive; a leader who can positively and productively add product impact to both strategic and tactical technology
Strong, influential communicator who is articulate and concise, demonstrated success interacting with senior management both in the business, corporate functions as well as the Operations, Business and Technology environments
Strong risk management and control mindset
Provides evaluative judgment based on analysis of factual information in complicated, unique and dynamic situations; draws on diverse range of internal and external sources
Self-reliant, good problem solver, results oriented
Demonstrated experience leading people and developing effective and diverse teams.
Ability to establish and build trust with professionals throughout the business as a leader, advisor and business partner to the organization with a clear client orientation.
Strong awareness of both external and internal best practice perspectives, maintaining a balanced and fresh viewpoint.
Ability to conceptualize aspects of the organization's model and its future development.

job_description:
The Centre for Advanced 2D Materials at the National University of Singapore is seeking to fill a manager position. This role forms part of the core team that oversees the Centre's day-to-day operations. provides administrative support to the Centre's activities and supports the Director and Admin Lead in domains of digital outreach/marketing, IT and IT related resource management, as well as user support.
Duties and Responsibilities
Website and Social Media Management
Manage and upkeep the Centre's website and social media platforms
Work with Directors and principal investigators/researchers to create and update contents on all digital medial platforms, e.g., Twitter, Facebook, YouTube and LinkedIn
Collaborate with NUS IT centre on website hosting and licensing, domain and web-related policy compliance
Create and manage micro-sites, web forms, calendars and booking systems
Research Benchmarking and Library Access
Collate, maintain and update reports on publications
Oversee the maintenance of research publication master list to ensure accurate single source for all reporting needs
Provide support and set up LibProxy access to users
Liaise with NUS Libraries to provide access to e-resources for visitors
IT Resource Management
Collate and propose the annual IT/AV budget plan
Monitor budget utilisation to ensure optimisation of financial resources
Manage procurement of IT assets, software, licenses, datasets, publications, etc
Manage and track IT assets (workstations, laptops, notebooks, iPads and printers, etc) with NUS IT centre
System Administration
Serve as IT focal (update server patches, apply BigFix, fix vulnerabilities, etc)
Liaise with NUS IT CERT and Vulnerability Management Team for compliance
Create, set up and procure system applications
Create and manage virtual machines
Set up and manage network access storage device
Manage the graphene virtual reality system
Liaise with the virtual reality application vendor for support and maintenance
Assist and guide users while using graphene virtual reality
BOSS Administration
Create, delete and transfer IPTEL accounts
Request for installation of new wifi hotspots or LAN points
SharePoint/nBox Management and Support
Manage and provide support on SharePoint/nBox sites
Liaise between site owners and NUS SharePoint/nBox administrators
Provide and maintain records of access/permission rights
Account and Access Management
Manage and request for the extension of staff accounts
Create and manage visitor accounts, classify them as partner or visitor
Manage and request for box accounts
Manage and update distribution lists and active directory group memberships
Provide temporary card access for visitors
Events
Propose and manage the technical setup for the Centre's events (conferences, workshops, seminars/webinars, social events, visits, meetings, etc)
Plan and support the publicity of events via website/social media channels
Design and disseminate event EDMs
Generate reports such as registration, attendance and post-event feedback
IT User Support (in collaboration with NUS IT centre)
Provide IT support to the Centre's members
Create knowledge base for users, such as FAQs, SOPs and instruction guides
Ensure IT assets are accounted for and optimised
Liaise with external vendors for remote and on-site support services
Configure/set up necessary IT/AV provisions for all staff and office needs
Install Software Centre and basic applications, such as Microsoft Office, Adobe Creative Cloud, WinZip, Origin, Pulse Secure, Teams and zoom
Provide advisory to colleagues on IT/AV matters
General Office Administration
Manage the Centre's role-based account, ensuring enquiries are addressed appropriately in a timley manner
Propose, implement and upkeep e-filing system
Other administrative tasks as required
Requirements
BSc degree in computer science, IT or other related field
At least five years of experience in providing IT support in educational or scientific research environment
Familiarity with University IT policies and guidelines is an advantage
Good knowledge of software relevant to scientific research and licensing policies
Proficient in creating social media presence (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn, etc)
Excellent command of English, both written and spoken
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite
Innovative problem solver with ability to multitask and a keen eye for details
Demonstrate high standard of professional integrity and ethics
Resilient and seek to achieve excellence in a fast-paced environment
A team player with a positive outlook
Interested applicants are invited to apply directly at our NUS Career Portal.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
More Information
Location: Kent Ridge Campus
Organization: Centre for Advanced 2D Materials
Department : Administration
Job requisition ID : 11611
At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students is one of our utmost priorities and covid vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require significant amount of physical interactions with student/staff/public members. Even for job roles that can be performed remotely, there will be instances where on campus presence is required. With effect from 15 January 2022, based on Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work at NUS premises. As such, we regret to inform that job applicants need to be fully covid vaccinated for successful employment with NUS.

job_description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
About MyRepublic:
Our purpose at MyRepublic is to transform people's lives by creating a connected world that is seamless, smart and safe, while innovating the way telcos operate.
MyRepublic is one of the fastest growing digital telco operators in the Asia-Pacific. Homegrown in sunny Singapore, we have operations in Singapore, Australia and New Zealand with a defining difference. We are the world's first telecommunications company powered by a proprietary cloud platform and pioneered a disruptive operating model with unparalleled efficiency and customer focus.
MyRepublic offers residential broadband, enterprise broadband, home voice, and mobile services. We are way more than just a telco or an ISP. We are the future beyond telcos.
RESPONSIBILITIES
The role:
Candidate is responsible for developing, maintaining and supporting our mobile app for iOS and Android which will be used by our customers in SG & ANZ for both our broadband and mobile service.
How you'll contribute to MyRepublic's success:
Developing new business features and building reusable components using React Native
Optimizing components for optimal performance across platforms with a consistent interface
Translating UI / UX designs and wireframes into high-quality code
Investigate and fix bugs
Work with stakeholders from different countries and timezones
What we offer in return:
Exciting opportunities to create and grow in a rapidly growing organisation that is a disruptor in the telco space.
Amazing colleagues and culture that encourages you to do your best work while staying authentic and true to yourself.
A work culture that puts your individual needs at the core: Remote, Hybrid or In-Office choose a work rhythm that suits you and your team. We focus on outcomes and believe that you can deliver your best work, working anywhere, anytime.
Wellness first. We believe that wellness goes beyond team celebrations and birthday parties. Our holistic approach to wellness gives you opportunities to recharge, connect and explore, at and outside work. In addition to the standard leave entitlements, we offer:
1 day of wellness leave every quarter for you to take or your health and wellbeing, and explore your personal passions.
20 days to work from anywhere each year, allowing you more flexibility to explore and connect with your interests while delivering work you will be proud about.
QUALIFICATIONS
We think you'll fit in great with us if you have:
Degree or Diploma in Computer Science or related field of study
Related certification will be a plus
Long-term passion for mobile app/frontend development
Able to multitask
Familiarity with reactJS functional components / hooks (must have)
Hands-on experience working with React Native (must have)
Experience working with CSS layout is a plus
Experience working with Photoshop is a plus
Strong self-learning ability
Well organized & attention to details
OTHER INFORMATION
The values and behaviour that we look for:
From being the first to launch 1Gbps broadband plans and the first network optimised broadband service for gaming in Singapore, to crafting workplace practices that put wellbeing at its core, our values guide us in everything we do at MyRepublic. It's the secret sauce that makes us tick. If you espouse the following, we know you would fit in great with us:
Never Settle: We dream big. We are constantly curious and embrace bold ideas.
Stronger Together: We create together. We win together, we fail together. We grow together, we celebrate together. We are at our strongest together.
Empowered to Deliver: We deliver on our commitments. We are empowered to move fast and with confidence to get the right things done.
We Care: We care for ourselves, one another and our customers. We value authenticity and embrace differences. We create the space to recharge, connect and explore to bring our best selves to work.
We believe that skills, knowledge and experience can come from a diverse range of life experiences. You may not have ALL the listed requirements for this role but this should not hold back! If you believe that you have what it takes for this position, are willing to learn, and you identify with the values and mission of MyRepublic, we would love to hear from you. We celebrate diversity and look forward to hearing from a diverse group of applicants. We do not discriminate on any factor in our hiring process.
Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - MyRepublic Group Limited

job_description:
TD Bank Group
Headquartered in Toronto, Canada, with approximately 90,000 employees in offices around the world, the Toronto-Dominion Bank and its subsidiaries are collectively known as TD Bank Group (TD). TD offers a full range of financial products and services to over 26 million customers worldwide through three key business lines:
Canadian Retail including TD Canada Trust, Business Banking, TD Auto Finance (Canada), TD Wealth (Canada), TD Direct Investing and TD Insurance
U.S. Retail including TD Bank, America's Most Convenient Bank, TD Auto Finance (U.S.), TD Wealth (U.S.) and TD's investment in Schwab
Wholesale Banking including TD Securities
TD had CDN$1.7 trillion in assets on October 31, 2021. TD also ranks among the world's leading online financial services firms, with more than 15 million active online and mobile customers. The Toronto-Dominion Bank trades on the Toronto and New York stock exchanges under the symbol TD.
In Singapore, TD operates as The Toronto-Dominion Bank, Singapore Branch and Toronto Dominion (South East Asia) Limited, which are collectively known as TD Singapore since 1979. The key business in Singapore is TD Securities which is part of Wholesale Banking.
Department Overview:
The TR Windows is responsible for maintaining standards for Microsoft Windows Server OS and X86 based hardware as well as infrastructure configuration and implementation for Windows server OS rebuilds.
The TR teams with in TDBFG are a unique group of individuals focused on P1 and P2 issues, root cause analyses and proactively improve the services we offer, while also being the gate keepers to ensure technology in our data centers is supportable for all in Operations and meets the standards of the organization.
Job Description / Accountabilities:
Lead the technical analysis and assessment of new submitted client OS support in-take requests, working closely with our technology and business partners to address submitted requests.
Ensure resulting solutions meet the needs of our business clients and stakeholders while adhering to the bank's technology and quality standards.
Maintain an understanding of business and technology directions as well as technology developments and industry trends.
Review and comment on the design, development, and implementation of solutions in partnership with engineering leads and architects.
Attention to detail while providing Windows OS support for our 2008, 2012, 2016, and 2019 platforms.
Act as point of escalation for unresolved Windows Server OS, ESX and UCS virtualization and hardware technical issues and work with vendors, consultants, and partners in other TS areas to develop solutions.
Develop and maintain strong working relationship with the various line of business/ ITS Management.
Required to review and provide input into project objectives and timelines (designing/building/testing/deploying).
Ensure timely and accurate communication and resolutionescalation of issues.
Monitor service delivery against commitments, prioritizing work activities.
Follow documented operational procedures and processes with minimal guidance from the team such as equipment requisitioning, network requisition, inventory, and asset management.
Analyze day-to-day processes for areas and methods of improvement.
Provide technical guidance to Build team and support staff.
Liaise with Engineering Teams to address system wide issues.
Liaise with Engineering Teams to understand net new technology being deployed and how it impacts Operational Teams. Ensure it meets operational readiness requirements.
Liaise with external vendors in providing support for our HP/Lenovo/Cisco UCS hardware.
Specific Educational Requirements / Accreditations:
MCSE/VMWare VCP.
College/University Graduate in Computer Studies.
Other Qualifications / Skills / Experience:
Excellent customer service track record.
Minimum 7 years of experience building, deploying and administering Microsoft Server Operating Systems (Windows 2008, Windows 2012, Windows 2016, Windows 2019).
Expert problem-solving skills to troubleshoot and resolve hardware and Windows Server OS issues.
In depth knowledge regarding IBM/HP/Cisco UCS server hardware (rack mount and blade technologies).
A thorough understanding of Microsoft Active Directory (AD) and security policies (GPO).
In depth knowledge of TCP/IP, VLANs, MS Clustering.
Familiar with the latest Cloud technologies (Azure, VMWare, etc.).
Familiar with hardware monitoring tools such as HPSIM and IBM Director.
Familiar with scripting and automation tools such as PowerShell and Python.
Knowledge of file/print environment configurations.
Understanding of Storage Area Networks (SAN).
Must be able to prioritize, working independently and in a team environment.
Highly organized and process driven.
Good written and oral communication skills.
Familiar with change management best practices.
Familiar with ITIL.
Inclusiveness:
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve, and creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.

job_description:
As a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE), you'll help build a meaningful engineering discipline, combining software and systems to develop creative engineering solutions to operations problems. Much of our support and software development focuses on optimizing existing systems, building infrastructure and reducing work through automation. You'll join a team of curious problem solvers with a diverse set of perspectives who are thinking big and taking risks. In this environment, you'll take the lead on relevant projects, supported by an organization that provides the support and mentorship you need to learn and grow. As an SRE, you'll be focused on running better production applications and systems.
You will be part of a dynamic team responsible for our Corporate & Investment Bank strategic platform that various CIB teams build their applications on. You'll put your experience to work across the board, in areas like change management, incident management, problem management, impact identification, management communication, risk and controls, client relationship management, service improvement, discovery/gathering/documenting of business needs, data and requirements.

Develop, test and debug automated tasks including apps, systems and infrastructure
Automate manual operational work by improving products or software
Troubleshoot priority incidents and facilitate blameless post evaluations
Work with development & infrastructure teams throughout the product life cycle ensuring the deployments meets business & controls requirements
Perform analytics on past data, such as incidents and usage patterns for predicting issues and take proactive steps to implement improvements
Build and drive adoption for greater self-healing and resiliency patterns
Lead and participate in performance tests, and identify bottlenecks and opportunities for optimization and capacity demands
Split time between operational work and engineering work
Work schedule involves weekday (4 days) and weekend (1 day) model
Qualifications:
BS/BA degree
Min 3 years of experience managing a large Unix platform in an enterprise environment
Proficient in Linux systems provisioning and configuration management tools such as Puppet, Ansible and Terraform. Advanced Linux knowledge is required
Proficient in at least one or more software languages such as Python, Java, Go with respect to designing, coding, testing and software delivery
Proficient in the development of automated tools, systems and services in multiple technology domains
Proficient knowledge of one or more infrastructure components such as networking, cloud services, orchestration tools, containerization, compute and storage systems
Proficient in service-level changes to a system and troubleshooting components
Design and implement and contribute to performance monitoring and capacity management tools

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

We provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk and extend liquidity in markets around the world.

1-year renewable contract

The Sales Solution Architect analyses, designs and develops roadmaps and implementation plans based on a current versus future state solution architecture. The candidate assesses near-term needs to establish business priorities, analyses and develop solutions architectural requirements, and ensures alignment of architectural requirements with the IT strategy.
Render presales technical support to client service teams

job_description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
Our purpose at MyRepublic is to transform people's lives by creating a connected world that is seamless, smart and safe, while innovating the way telcos operate.
MyRepublic is one of the fastest growing digital telco operators in Asia-Pacific. Homegrown in sunny Singapore, we have operations in Singapore, Australia and New Zealand with a defining difference. We are the world's first telecommunications company powered by a proprietary cloud platform who has pioneered a disruptive operating model with unparalleled efficiency and customer focus.
The engine behind MyRepublic's success, besides its people, is its next-gen digital platform that automates and integrates its backend processes, while driving a seamless customer experience.
MyRepublic offers residential broadband, enterprise broadband, home voice, and mobile services. We are way more than just a telco or an ISP. We exist to transform people's lives by creating a connected world that is seamless, smart, and safe while innovating the way telcos operate. We are the future beyond telcos.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Maintaining coverage of retail stores needed for our operations and assist walk in customers at retail stores to sign up our services.
To actively promote MyRepublic Fibre Broadband services, as well as other products and services
To handle customers enquiries on products and services
To follow up with customers regarding their application for services
Wiling to work on rotational shifts and locations
Wiling to work on weekends, public holidays and roadshow locations
Possess strong selling skills
Self-driven and able to work under pressure
Able to work independently
Self-motivated and possess initiative to achieve targets set
What we offer in return:
Exciting opportunities to create and grow in a rapidly growing organisation that is a disruptor in the telco-tech space.
Amazing colleagues and culture that encourages you to do your best work while staying authentic and true to yourself.
A workplace that puts your individual needs at the core: Remote, Hybrid or In-Office choose a work rhythm that suits you and your team. We focus on outcomes and believe that you can deliver your best work, working anywhere, anytime.
Wellness first. We believe that wellness goes beyond team celebrations and birthday parties. Our holistic approach to wellness gives you opportunities to recharge, connect and explore, at and outside work. In addition to the standard leave entitlements, we offer:
1 day of wellness leave every quarter for you to take for your health and wellbeing, and explore your personal passions.
20 days to work from anywhere each year, allowing you more flexibility to explore and connect with your interests while delivering work you will be proud about.
QUALIFICATIONS

GCE 'O/'N Level, with or without experience, or with minimum 1 year's sales experience
Knowledge of wireless and internet solutions would be an advantage
Positive attitude with a passion for delivering excellent service quality to customers

If you believe that you have what it takes for this position, are willing to learn, and you identify with the values and mission of MyRepublic, we would love to hear from you. We celebrate diversity and look forward to hearing from a diverse group of applicants. We do not discriminate on any factor in our hiring process.

job_description:
About NUS IT
NUS Information Technology is the cornerstone to providing reliable, high-performance and secure IT solutions and effective IT governance for the campus. Here at NUS IT, we aim to transform NUS into a borderless computing community providing knowledge at its fingertips by enhancing the use of effective applications and services for teaching and learning.
We drive a culture that is forward-looking. With a strong passion for IT, our people are always striving to improve, push boundaries and innovate with a can-do attitude. We embrace collaboration, open communication and knowledge sharing. If you see yourself thriving in a dynamic environment and breaking new grounds with innovative ideas, you will find yourself at home in NUS IT.
As part of our team, you can look forward an empowered work environment that allows you to take charge of your own career path. We provide competitive remuneration as well as flexible work arrangements to enable your growth and development. We pride ourselves on our diverse workforce, and are committed to transforming NUS into a leading global University shaping the future.
https://nusit.nus.edu.sg/
Job Description
The Associate Director /Senior Manager (Digital Workspace) will join the Infrastructure (Digital Workspace) team as a technical leadership role with responsibilities in the planning, delivery and management of a large-scale end-user computing environment. This is inclusive of desktop computing, device security, user authentication, user experience, compatibility, connectivity and performance in accessing the campus-wide infrastructure and digital resources provisioned by the University.
Duties & Responsibilities
Manage a hyper converged physical/virtual desktop environment and user mobile devices by enabling central push of OS images, security controls, software updates, patches, license controls and troubleshooting.
Manage user, device and biometric based authentication for client computers and mobile access to the campus network, published web-based, mobile and SaaS applications.
Identify trends and develop insights on end-user device usage, access locations, types and baseline configurations, etc. for security, compliance, service enhancement and continuous operations review.
Continuously re-engineer the end-point architecture, operating environment and connectivity in order to enhance ease of use, performance, security and overall user experience.
Perform as team lead on staff coaching and mentoring, and manage user communications, release coordination and reporting.
Qualifications
University degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related disciplines.
About 10 years of working experience in IT, inclusive of 5 years experience in desktop and mobile device management, security & compliance, user authentication, single-sign-on and virtualization, etc.
Good knowledge with hands-on experience in Microsoft Active Directory, ADFS, Azure Cloud, Trend Micro and VMWare Horizon/Workspace ONE technologies.
A problem solver and effective team lead with proven analytical, writing and communication skills.
Interested applicants are invited to apply directly at our NUS Career Portal.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Covid-19 Message
At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required.
In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS.

tech_stack: Machine Learning  Scalability  Data Structures  Software Engineering  MySQL  Dynamodb  Tuning  Haskell  Python  Java  C#  Api  Backend Development  Erlang  ocaml  Architecture  Pipelines  Analytical Abilities  Demand Planning  code architecture
job_description:
Life at Grab:
At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia.
Get to know the Role:
As such, we are seeking talented & passionate Engineers to join our team, you will have opportunities to work on multiple backend service clusters as well as participating in machine learning pipelines. It is very important that our team member take initiatives to identify problems, and have the right mindset and skill sets to solve them.
The day-to-day activities:
Work with engineering team on designs/architectures geared towards scale, performance and high availability.
Design and write with the cutting edge GO language to improve the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of Grab's range of services
Participate in code and design reviews to maintain our high development standards
Engage in service capacity and demand planning, software performance analysis, tuning and optimization
Collaborate with product and experience teams to define and prototype feature specifications
Process real-time transaction and telematics data at scale to build new Safety features
Work with Data Scientist team to implement models in real-time, testing and monitoring the system
Build technologies to test and validate insights via rapid experimentation and deployment
The must haves:
A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology or related fields
Strong Computer Science fundamentals in algorithms and data structures
Familiarity with running large scale web services; understanding of systems internals and networking are a plus
Strong understanding of system performance and scaling
Possess excellent communication, sharp analytical abilities with proven design skills, able to think critically of the current system in terms of growth and stability
You can be a good coder in any language (C++, C, Java, Scala, Rust, Haskell, OCaml, Erlang, Python, Ruby, PHP, Node.JS, C# etc.), but willing to work on Golang
Tech Stack
Our core services tech stack consists of Golang with Redis, MySQL, DynamoDB, Elasticsearch data stores as well as HAProxy load balancers. They all run on the AWS cloud infrastructure with auto-scaling abilities. We use GitHub for our code repository and we adhere to the basic Continuous Delivery tenets utilising a host of tools to support our release pipeline and code quality.
We recognize that with these individual attributes come different workplace challenges, and we will work with Grabbers to address them in our journey towards creating inclusion at Grab for all Grabbers.
If you share our vision of driving South East Asia forward, apply to join our team today.
Get to know Grab:
Grab is more than just the leading ride-hailing and mobile payments platform in Southeast Asia. We use data and technology to improve everything from transportation to payments and financial services across a region of more than 620 million people. We work with governments, drivers, passengers, merchants, and the community, to solve critical problems in Southeast Asia.
Grab began as a taxi-hailing app in 2012, but we have since extended our product platform to include GrabCar, GrabShare, GrabBike, GrabHitch, GrabExpress, GrabFood, GrabCoach, GrabShuttle, GrabCycle. We recently launched our fintech platform GrabFinancial, which consists of payments, lending and insurance. Our latest addition is GrabVentures, an in-house incubation platform. We are focused on pioneering new commuting and payment alternatives for drivers and passengers with an emphasis on convenience, safety, and reliability. Currently, we offer services in 8 countries.
Our R&D offices are in Singapore, Seattle, Beijing, Bangalore, Jakarta and Vietnam. We aspire to unlock the true potential of Southeast Asia and look for like-minded individuals to join us on this ride.
If you share our vision of driving South East Asia forward, apply to join our team today.

We are founded in 2016, and we provide cybersecurity as a service (Governance & Policies, Access Control Management, Secure Coding, Patch & Vulnerability Management, Monitoring & SIEM, Backups & Incident Response, Third Party Management, Data Loss Protection, Threat Intelligence) and we are building an amazing cyber platform called IMMUNE; a 360 fully-integrated cybersecurity platform delivering all the tech, with none of the jargon, empowering Small and Medium Businesses to stay one step ahead of black-hatted criminals.

The primary focus of the selected candidate would be on developing our SaaS platform components implementing and executing them following well-known Python commands and workflows. job_title: Data Scientist Team Lead, AI Coe
tech_stack: Machine Learning  Big Data  Data Mining  Python  Data Science  Leadership  Analytical Skills  Modeling  Segmentation  Mathematics  Project Management  interventions  Team Lead  Statistics  Publications
job_description:
In the AI CoE, we are looking at mid and long-term innovation opportunities driven by AI. A data scientist in the AI CoE will therefore focus on explorations, new business use cases for the bank and also for the conglomerate Aboitiz. This will entail collaborations internally but also with external partners to leapfrog our innovation opportunities. External partners include universities and research institutes with which we aim to publish peer-reviewed scientific papers.
You will be working with a cross-functional team to uncover solutions using data in order to uncover new business opportunities with AI, increase revenue, reduce costs, improve quality and performance, and manage risks while ensuring compliance with applicable regulation, laws, or internal guidelines of the bank.
What you'll do
Individual contributor role who should be able to exercise functional leadership over other data scientists that s/he might work with in UBP or other party.
Team lead within the AI CoE guiding the AI CoE members and being a role model with the hands-on AI work
Develop a good understanding of business operations and easily translate these to data science challenges to create quantifiable business impact
Utilize a variety of modeling tools, statistical analysis, and AI including Machine Learning, Deep Learning, NLP in developing solutions to guide business decision-making and implementation
Analyze, aggregate, and understand community behaviors, preferences, and profitability through supervised and unsupervised segmentation techniques to inform business strategies and decisions, product offerings, and community-level interventions
Facilitate the data science lifecycle from data collection to model deployment in collaboration with relevant stakeholders and partners
Incorporates sound methodology to build, validate and test ML or NLP approaches
Develop engines that synergize and optimize decisioning from product scores, propensity scores, profitability scores, cost, among other variables.
Work both independently and collaboratively with team members and stakeholders with varied background
Uses our data science platforms and cloud providers to accelerate the progress of our team's work
Contribute to the AI skill development by structured knowledge sharing
Contribute to scientific publications
Who you are
Has proven track record in developing analytical and implementation frameworks and designing tests. Multiple years of experience as data scientist and team lead of data scientists is preferred.
Has knowledge of R, Python, and Machine Learning
Has excellent organizational, communication, presentation, project management and analytical skills
Preferred to have a Master's degree in Data Science/Analytics or relevant certifications

The Sales Solution Architect analyses, designs and develops roadmaps and implementation plans based on a current versus future state solution architecture. job_description:
Solution Centre of Excellence (SCoE)
As the Solution Financial Analyst, you will be part of a larger and cohesive team of 50+ solution specialists, known as the Solution Centre of Excellence (SCoE). The SCoE represents the largest collection of solution architects, primarily involved in presales engagements and originations. The team structure accommodates several technology specializations (namely, AppDev, Cloud, Managed Services, AI, InfraSec, Packaged and System Engineering) and mirroring the sales coverage of clients within NCS portfolio. The team is expected to undertake complex and risky opportunities to produce bespoke solutions to address specific client pain-points. If you want to have a hand in crafting world-first, leading edge solutions, then SCoE will be the ideal playground for you to grow and broaden your skills and knowledge as a solution architect.
SCoE is expanding and has roles for a broad spectrum of technologies and domains.
Solution Financial Analyst Job Role Description
Perform financial consolidation, forecasting, reporting, and operational metrics tracking
Analyze financial data and create financial models for decision support
Report on financial performance and prepare for regular leadership reviews
Analyze past results, perform variance analysis, identify trends, and make recommendations for improvements
Evaluate financial performance by comparing and analyzing actual results with plans and forecasts
Guide the cost analysis process by establishing and enforcing policies and procedures
Provide analysis of trends and forecasts and recommend actions for optimization
Recommend actions by analyzing and interpreting data and making comparative analyses; study proposed changes in methods and materials
Identify and drive process improvements, including the creation of standard and ad-hoc reports, tools, and Excel dashboards
Increase productivity by developing automated reporting/forecasting tools
Maintain a strong financial analysis foundation creating forecasts and models
Basic Qualifications
0-3+ years of business finance or other relevant experience
High proficiency in financial modeling techniques
Strong fluency with Excel formulas and functions
BA, BS, or B.Com degree required (Bachelor's Degree in Accounting/Finance/Economics)
Strong analytical and data gathering skills
Good business acumen
Personality and Interpersonal Skills
Ability to streamline functions and passion to learn and grow
Strong interpersonal skills, including written and oral communication skills
Comfort dealing with ambiguity and the ability to work independently
Experience working with, and presenting to, senior executives
Excellent communication and presentation skills; be comfortable interacting with executive-level management
Strong financial modeling experience

job_description:
As trustee of the nation's retirement savings, the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public, you will find your niche in our big family.
Information Technology
IT systems form the backbone of our operations. We are looking for individuals with passion and IT expertise, to help us improve the delivery of our systems and services. The Board's IT systems support a high daily volume of financial transactions for CPF members. In addition to keeping the lights on, the Board also keeps pace with the external environment through innovation in its IT systems.
Responsibilities
You will be responsible for addressing the security posture for web applications. You will also be involved in software development lifecycle activities such as analysis, design, development, implementation and maintenance of a variety of mission-critical web applications using Microsoft and cloud technologies.
Requirements
Relevant web application experience
Identify app security lapses in a system and mitigation methods
Familiar with technologies like SAST, DAST or IAST
Familiar with security testing tools like Burp, ZAP, Nessus, Fortify SCA, CheckMarx, etc.
Define app security practices for one or multiple systems/applications
Analyse scan results and address possible app security loopholes and threats
Anticipate and prepare for the next evolution of app security testing trends
Develop techniques to ensure development teams find flaws before they are introduced into production
Lead software security initiatives, eg bug bounty program
Oversee the security posture of web applications
What you can expect
A challenging and rewarding career where you can contribute to national objectives
A friendly work environment with like-minded colleagues to co-create and collaborate together
A flexible schedule where work is not constrained to the office and 9-to-6 workdays
A productive yet growth-oriented workplace with flexible dress code where you are empowered to decide your appropriate outfit for the day
Position is on 2-year contract on commencement with possibility of renewal and conversion to permanent
Grow and gain valuable work experience where you can accelerate your career through promotion opportunities subject to individual performance
Comprehensive rewards package
Annual leave and pro-family leave
Medical and dental benefits
Access to recreational activities

job_description:
About CoverWallet
CoverWallet, an Aon company, was founded in 2015 to reinvent the $100 billion small business insurance industry by using data, design, and technology. As a part of Aon, a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries, CoverWallet has the mentality and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational company.
CoverWallet is the easiest way for businesses to understand, buy, and manage insurance online and has been recognized as a CNBC Upstart 100, won the Best Insurtech Solution from the Benzinga Awards and was named One of the Most Entrepreneurial Companies in America by Entrepreneur Magazine.
What we offer:
The possibility to disrupt one of the biggest industries, and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world.
The possibility to build your career in one of the leading startups in the USA.
Great offices in New York, Madrid, Sevilla and near the beach in Valencia, Singapore and Poland
Competitive salary
Education budget
Full remote
Fun and fast-paced environment
Responsibilities:
Design, implement and deploy our software products.
Produce clean, efficient code based on specifications.
Integrate software services and third-party services.
Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing software.
Work as part of a team with other engineers to build and deliver features.
Participate in code reviews, identify and apply best practices for software development.
Create technical documentation for reference.
Prepare accurate implementation task lists/time estimates and deliver assignments based on requirements.
Contribute to the security of our systems.
Contribute to recruitment activities.
Produce and promote clean code.

From static design to Production running code.
Demonstrated UI design and UX sensibilities.
Responsive design, mobile-first.
JavaScript coder.
SEO techniques awareness.
Cross-browser compatibility issues knowledge, client-side performance.
AngularJS, React or any other JS libraries are a plus.
Familiarity with MVC Ruby on Rails web framework or others.
Familiarity with Agile development methodologies, and a delivery process based on pull-requests.
Experience with test-driven software design.
Knowledge of cloud infrastructure and deployment processes.
Ability to learn new languages and technologies.
Excellent English communication skills.
Team player.
Usually BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.

job_description:
Digital Marketing Manager
Location - Singapore

The Client
The client is Europe's leading executive education establishment with presence in Singapore. As a part of its expansion, looking for a digital marketing manager who will report to the Head of Marketing and help organization grow.

Job Description & What you will do
You will be an active part of business growth in the region. Working closely with the marketing head and the entire SEA team to ensure first class planning and execution of the campaigns to have tangible results. It will require you to drive high quality lead generation and conversion across all programs and solutions by continuous optimization of digital marketing efforts with best practices, including but not limited to Analyzing campaign performance, offering insights on key success factors and areas for optimization, Lead campaign optimization efforts with the end goal of improving campaign performance with (CTR, CVR, volume of leads), Design and perform A/B testing plans for campaigns, including landing page, ad copy, assets, geographies. Champion best practices for landing pages - develop, implement and continuously improve landing pages for paid media campaigns, integration across paid, owned and earned media, campaign set-up, landing pages, call to actions, collaborate with digital marketing agency and internal UX and digital team to perform effective campaign optimization.

What you will need
Other than your positive attitude and ability to work independently while collaborating with teams, it is good to have Data-driven, analytical, proficient with digital metrics and qualitative insights, Proven ability to manage end-to-end projects, in a matrix environment and involving several stakeholders and with minimal supervision, Eager to learn about evolving marketing channels and digital growth platforms, Advanced experience/knowledge of key digital marketing tools: Google analytics, Google AdWords, Google Data Studio, heat map tools, Crazy Egg. Content management system (preferably EPI server or WordPress), testing tools (A/B multivariate testing strategies). job_title: Partner Development Manager, WWPS Partner Transformation Team
job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for world class candidates to grow our AWS Partner Network (APN) in the Asia-Pacific region, and increase adoption of AWS services for Public Sector customers. The APN includes tens of thousands of Independent Software Vendors (ISVs), SaaS and PaaS providers, as well as Systems Integrators, Managed Service Providers and Professional Services Consultants.

Key job responsibilities
As a Partner Development Manager on the Worldwide Public Sector team, you will have the exciting opportunity to develop our community of partners in the Asia-Pacific region and accelerate AWS adoption by Government, Education, and Non-Profit customers. In this role, you will establish deep relationships within a set of AWS partners and will lead them through a customized partner development plan, across a diverse set of developmental milestones.

The ideal candidate will possess both a business background to gain executive-level buy-in, as well as a technical background to interact with software developers and solutions architects. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and communicate clearly with a variety of internal and external stakeholders. Success criteria for this position will be heavily metrics driven and require strong organizational skills.

As a shared services team, we work with Public Sector Partner Account Managers in leading qualified, nominated AWS Partners through a discrete set of Advanced Partner & Business Development milestones. Our PDM's typically work with between 15 and 25 partners, with the average engagement lasting between 6-12 months.

A day in the life
. Gain executive buy-in from strategic partners to accelerate their AWS technical and sales capabilities.
. Execute partner capability assessment to determine strengths and gaps in current AWS practice.
. Develop comprehensive partner development plans and execute on metrics driven milestones.
. Present the AWS & APN value prop to position benefits of an AWS focused technology practice.
. Manage numerous partner requests and time demands concurrently, while exceeding quarterly partner development goals.
. Earn trust with internal and external stakeholders to accelerate partner success.
. Utilize CRM systems (Salesforce.com), data visualization (Tableau), and other internal systems to establish a sound record of work with each partner and customer.
. Understand and navigate public sector contracting vehicles and customer procurement.
. Understand the technical considerations and certifications specific to the public sector.
. Execute the strategic sales and business development plan while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. sales teams, service teams, legal, support, etc).
. Evangelize partner capabilities across internal sales and business development teams.
. Prepare and give business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks to closing new customers.
. Manage complex contract executions and liaison with the AWS legal teams.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

o 5+ years of partner/business development, enterprise sales, and/or program/product management experience with a focus on public sector
o 5+ years of experience managing external customer/partner relationships
o 5+ years of experience with technology platform sales with an understanding of government IT, data centers, and cloud adoption.
o Familiarity and experience supporting Public Sector sales, business development, procurement, or contracting in APJ markets.
o Proficiency in Salesforce.com and Outlook
o o Fluent language skills required (both written and verbal) in English
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

o Self-starter and self-motivated with an entrepreneurial spirit and the ability to collaborate to solve complex business challenges.
o Experience using data visualization and analytics tools to make data driven decisions
o Understand the technical considerations and certifications specific to the public sector.
o Excellent writing skills. The ability to author original text including detailed account plans and strategy planning documents.
o Experience working with Distribution channel
o Excellent communication skills with the ability to lead executive level meetings understanding the audience and the ability to conduct Executive Briefing type activities.
o Experience developing an indirect sales channel, growing partner competencies, and delivering sell to and sell-through revenue.
o Ability to drive strategic technology discussions at multiple levels with partners and customers.
o Fluency in Korean, Bahasa, Malay, Vietnamese, or Thai is an advantage

Develop and enhance a solar tracker digital twin

3. Integrate the dashboard and communication interface to the physical solar tracker to form a complete system
